Oil Life Reset Instructions: Scroll to "Vehicle Settings" and select it in the menu. Then scroll to "Maintenance Info" and select it in the menu, and the oil life will be displayed. Select "Reset" to change the oil life to 100%.

With the power mode ON go to the MAINTENANCE INFO group and press the right selector wheel to display the OIL LIFE RESET on the multi-information display. Using the right selector wheel, select RESET and then push in the right selector wheel to reset the OIL LIFE display to 100%. The displayed maintenance items will disappear.

With the power mode ON go to the MAINTENANCE INFO group and press the right selector wheel to display the OIL LIFE RESET on the multi-information display. Using the right selector wheel, select RESET and then push in the right selector wheel to reset the OIL LIFE display to 100%. The displayed maintenance items will disappear.

Turn the power mode to "On". Push the right selector wheel to scroll until the engine oil life is displayed. Make sure all the doors are closed, and push and hold the right selector wheel for about 10 seconds to enter the reset mode. Select "All Due Items" using the right selector wheel., and press the right selector wheel to change the oil life to 100%.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: Turn the ignition on, and push the "Menu" button on the turn signal switch. Using the selection wheel, scroll to "Oil Life Reset". Push the "Set/Clr" button on the turn signal switch and push the brake pedal at the same time.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

To reset, display the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the DIC using the DIC controls on the right side of the steering wheel. Press and hold the CHECK MARK button to clear the CHANGE OIL SOON message and OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. Access the VEHICLE INFORMATION MENU by pressing the DIC menu button on the turn signal lever. Scroll through the menu items to find REMAINING OIL LIFE using the thumbwheel and press SET/CLR. The oil life will reset to 100%.

CHANGE ENGINE OIL message can be reset after an oil change by pressing the TRIP button to display the OIL LIFE percentage. Press and hold RESET for 2 seconds until OIL LIFE REMAINING 100% appears. Repeat the procedure if the CHANGE ENGINE OIL light comes back on when the vehicle is restarted.

To reset display the REMAINING OIL LIFE percentage by scrolling through the DIC INFO pages menu. While the OIL LIFE display is active press and hold the SEL button on the DIC and the OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

Without starting the engine, turn the ignition key to the ON position. For vehicles with push button start: Without attempting to start the engine and without pressing the brake pedal, press and hold the START/STOP button for 2 seconds. Simultaneously press and hold both the brake and accelerator pedals until the display shows SERVICE: OIL RESET IN PROG then after about 25 seconds SERVICE: OIL RESET COMPLETE. Release both pedals and the OIL RESET message will go away. Turn the key to OFF. On push button start vehicles press the START/STOP button to completely turn off vehicle.

To reset OIL LIFE turn ON ignition switch and press the METER SELECT/RESET button several times until the display shows the engine oil life indicator. For approximately 10 seconds press and hold the SELECT/RESET button until the codes for the engine oil life and the the maintenance items blink. Release and then press and hold again (about 5 seconds) until the codes disappear and the ENGINE OIL LIFE shows 100.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: Press the left or right meter control to select the star symbol. Press the up and down arrow keys of the meter control. Select "Scheduled Maintenance" on the settings display. Choose "Yes" on the "Scheduled Maintenance" screen. Once the maintenance light is reset, a message saying "The Data Has Been Reset" will be displayed.

Press the left or right meter control to select the star symbol. Press the up and down arrow keys of the meter control. Select "Scheduled Maintenance" on the settings display. Choose "Yes" on the "Scheduled Maintenance" screen. Once the maintenance light is reset, a message saying "The Data Has Been Reset" will be displayed.

ENGINE OIL maintenance data can be reset by pressing the DISP button to clear the display. Turn ignition to OFF and then to IG-ON while holding down the trip meter reset button for more than 7 seconds and the display shows OIL MILEAGE RESET. At that time a tone will sound and the master warning light will be lit. System reset will complete after 5 seconds.

Oil Capacity: All Wheel Drive . 6.4 liters Rear Wheel Drive . 6.2 liters with filter
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset switch the multi-information display to the settings screen while the engine is running and select MAINTENANCE SYSTEM. Select YES and the display will show a message when reset is complete.

Oil Capacity: All Wheel Drive . 9.0 liters Rear Wheel Drive 8.5 liters with filter
Oil Life Reset Instructions: With the engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn OFF the engine. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET while turning the ignition to IGNITION ON without starting engine and continue to hold until COMPLETE is shown in the TRIP METER. Reset mode will be cancelled if the engine is started.

To reset select the display screen button on the top right of the meter control switch on the steering wheel. Select the SETTINGS display button by scrolling left or right on the METER CONTROL switch. On the center of the METER CONTROL switch press ENTER/SET. Select the OIL MAINTENANCE screen by scrolling up or down on the METER CONTROL switch then press and hold ENTER/SET, select YES, and press ENTER/SET. The multi-information display will show a message to confirm reset.

To reset select the display screen button on the top right of the meter control switch on the steering wheel. Select the SETTINGS display button by scrolling left or right on the METER CONTROL switch. On the center of the METER CONTROL switch press ENTER/SET. Select the OIL MAINTENANCE screen by scrolling up or down on the METER CONTROL switch then press and hold ENTER/SET, select YES, and press ENTER/SET. The multi-information display will show a message to confirm reset.
To reset switch the multi-information display to the settings screen while the engine is running and select MAINTENANCE SYSTEM. Select YES and the display will show a message when reset is complete.

On the left hand side oof the information display go to the main menu bar. Select SETTINGS by scrolling up or down and then select OIL LIFE RESET. Press and hold the RESET button until OIL LIFE is restored to 100%.

On the left hand side oof the information display go to the main menu bar. Select SETTINGS by scrolling up or down and then select OIL LIFE RESET. Press and hold the RESET button until OIL LIFE is restored to 100%.

Press the right arrow button on the right side of the steering wheel. Scroll to the settings message. To reset access the main menu on the message center. Select the SETTINGS tab by scrolling the UP and DOWN arrow buttons then press OK. Select the VEHICLE tab using the UP and DOWN arrow buttons then scroll to OIL LIFE RESET and reset by pressing and holding the OK button.
Turn the ignition on. Press and hold the "Trip" button. Continue holding down the "Trip" button for more than five seconds until the light flashes.

Reset 1: Push and hold the illumination knob while the ignition is off. Continue to press the illumination knob for more than five seconds. The warning light should flash when the procedure is complete. Reset 2: Go to the "Applications" screen, and select "Maintenance". Select the item you want to reset by switching the tab.

Reset 1: Push and hold the illumination knob while the ignition is off. Continue to press the illumination knob for more than five seconds. The warning light should flash when the procedure is complete. Reset 2: Go to the "Applications" screen, and select "Maintenance". Select the item you want to reset by switching the tab.
Go to the "Applications" screen, and select "Vehicle Status Monitor". Select "Maintenance", and select the item you want to reset by switching the tab.

Reset 1: Push and hold the illumination knob while the ignition is off. Continue to press the illumination knob for more than five seconds. The warning light should flash when the procedure is complete. Reset 2: Go to the "Applications" screen, and select "Maintenance". Select the item you want to reset by switching the tab.

Push the scroll back button until "Full Service" is highlighted, and push the "Ok" button. The service items should appear on the display. Push the scroll back button until "Confirm Serv" is highlighted, and push the "Ok" button. The "Service Carried Out" message should appear on the display. Select the type of oil used with the scroll forward button, and push the "Ok" button. Push the scroll back button until "Yes" is highlighted, and push the "Ok" button. "Full Service Completed" should be shown on the display. If it is not, try the procedure again.

Push the scroll back button until "Confirm Serv" is highlighted, and push the "Ok" button. The "Service Carried Out" message should appear on the display. "Full Service Completed" should be shown on the display. If it is not, try the procedure again.

To reset, make sure that doors, hood, and trunk lids are closed then turn the key to the 1 position. The multifunction display should show the standard display. If it does not, repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to select the standard display. Repeatedly press the system selection button until TRIP is highlighted in the display and remains for 5 seconds. Immediately within that 5 seconds press and hold the ACCEPT AND END PHONE CALL button and within 1 second press and hold OK.The workshop menu with the tabs VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMNETER TEST, CHANGE BRAKE PADS, AND ASSYST PLUS will show in the multifuntion display. Repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select and highlight the ASSYST PLUS tab then press OK to confirm. The multifunction display will show SERVICE DATA AND FULL SERVICE. Select and highlight FULL SERVICE by pressing the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. CONFIRM SERV and other current service items will be shown in the display. Select and highlight CONFIRM SERV using the FORWARD and BACKWARD scroll button and press OK to confirm. The display will show the ENGINE OIL SELECTION. Use the FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select the oil specification and press OK to confirm. Oil selected and SERV CONDUCTED? will be shown in the multifunction display. Select and highlight YES using the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. TAKE BACK NOT POSSIBLE, CONFIRM, and CANCEL TABS WILL SHOW IN THE MULTIFUNCTION DISPLAY. Select and highlight the configuration using the scroll buttons and press OK to confirm. When display will shows FULL SERVICE CARRIED OUT press OK. Press BACK and VCS OFF button repeatedly until the standard display is shown and turn the key to 0.

Make sure all doors, hood, and trunk are closed, and turn the ignition to position "1". Use the finger pad navigation to select the "Trip" menu on the display. Swipe using the finger navigation pad once in the "Trip" menu to select "Total Distance" on the display. Push and hold the "Back" button for a couple of seconds, and press the finger pad navigation to close out of the shop level. Push the "Back" button until the workshop entry menu shows in the display.

Push the scroll back button until "Yes" is highlighted, and push the "Ok" button. The "Full Service Completed" message should show on the display.

Oil Capacity: Automatic Trans . 4.6 liters . Manual Trans . 4.3 liters with filter

Oil Life Reset Instructions: Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON position. On the left side of the display press the square button to display the SETTINGS mode. To display MAINTENANCE, press the circular button until MAINTENANCE is highlighted then press the circular button to set desired interval and press the square button to open the RESET mode. Enter desired distance and select RESET. Enter desired time or distance then repeat the steps to reset ENGINE OIL FILTER.

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON position. On the left side of the display press the square button to display the SETTINGS mode. To display MAINTENANCE, press the circular button until MAINTENANCE is highlighted then press the circular button to set desired interval and press the square button to open the RESET mode. Enter desired distance and select RESET. Enter desired time or distance then repeat the steps to reset ENGINE OIL FILTER.

On the display select OIL, FILTER on the maintenance screen and use the following items to input the maintenance distance. To change the mileage press the NEXT switch 0 then press and hold to increase every 600 miles of 1,000km. To set no reminders set to "_". Go to the RESET screen and press NEXT screen to reset the accumulated mileage to zero and press the the square enter switch to confirm.

Oil Capacity: EX NIS RS . 4.5 liters . NISMO RS . 4.3 liters with filter

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset use the NISSAN controller to display the screen to change the maintenance interval and select one of the reminder keys ENGINE OIL, OIL FILTER reminder. Using the NISSAN controller select the interval key to change the maintenance interval. Press the BACK button to accept the changes. Using the NISSAN controller select the RESET DISTANCE key to reset the reminder schedule distance to 0 mi.
Go to the message center menu. Use the left and right arrow buttons to scroll to and select the "Maintenance Tab". Scroll down to the "Oil Life Reset", and press and hold the "Ok" button.

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON position. On the left side of the display press the square button to display the SETTINGS mode. To display MAINTENANCE, press the circular button until MAINTENANCE is highlighted then press the circular button to set desired interval and press the square button to open the RESET mode. Enter desired distance and select RESET. Enter desired time or distance then repeat the steps to reset ENGINE OIL FILTER.

Use the "Enter" button and directional arrows on the vehicle information display. Select "Settings", then "Maintenance", and then "Oil and Filter". In this menu, the maintenance interval can be changed or reset.

Use the "Enter" button and directional arrows on the vehicle information display. Select "Settings", then "Maintenance", and then "Oil and Filter". In this menu, the maintenance interval can be changed or reset.

Use the "Enter" button and directional arrows on the vehicle information display. Select "Settings", then "Maintenance", and then "Oil and Filter". In this menu, the maintenance interval can be changed or reset.

Use the "Enter" button and directional arrows on the vehicle information display. Select "Settings", then "Maintenance", and then "Oil and Filter". In this menu, the maintenance interval can be changed or reset.

To reset, turn the ignition to the ON position and and press the TRIP COMPUTER CHANGE button near the speedometer on the instrument panel for about 3 seconds to display the OIL CHANGE INFORMATION and WRENCH symbol then the distance to oil change interval mile schedule can be adjusted.

Transfer Case: ATF-4 or Multi Vehicle Synthetic ATF
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset cycle the ignition to the ON/RUN position without starting the engine and without pressing on the brake pedal. Scroll downward through the MAIN MENU to the VEHICLE INFO menu by pressing and releasing the DOWN arrow button. To access the OIL LIFE screen press and release the RIGHT arrow button. Access the the OIL LIFE RESET screen by pressing and holding the RIGHT arrow button for 1 second. Select YES by pressing and releasing the DOWN arrow button. To select reset of OIL LIFE press and release the Right arrow button. Exit the EXIC screen by pressing and releasing the UP arrow button.

To reset cycle the ignition to the ON/RUN position without starting the engine or pressing on the brake pedal. Slowly but fully depress the accelerator pedal 3 times in less than 10 seconds then cycle ignition to OFF/LOCK.

To reset cycle the ignition to the ON/RUN position without starting the engine or pressing on the brake pedal. Slowly but fully depress the accelerator pedal 3 times in less than 10 seconds then cycle ignition to OFF/LOCK.

Push the up and down arrow switch below the emergency flasher to select the maintenance menu, and press "Enter". Set the oil change interval, and press the "Enter" button. The same procedure is done to set the filter change interval.

Push the up and down arrow switch below the emergency flasher to select the maintenance menu, and press "Enter". Set the oil change interval, and press the "Enter" button. The same procedure is done to set the filter change interval.
To reset turn the engine switch to IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) while pressing and holding the display change button until the TRIP meter shows 000000.

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.

Use the trip "Odo/Trip" button to select "Trip A", and then turn the ignition off. Hold the "Odo/Trip" button and turn the ignition on, and continue holding while the display shows "Resetting Maintenance Data".

With the TRIP METER A showing turn the engine switch to LOCK. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button and without starting the engine turn the ignition switch to the On position and continue to hold until 000000 is displayed on the TRIP METER.

With the TRIP METER A showing turn the engine switch to LOCK. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button and without starting the engine turn the ignition switch to the On position and continue to hold until 000000 is displayed on the TRIP METER.

Push the left or right arrow of the meter control switch, and select the gear symbol. Push the up and down arrow of the meter control switch, and select "Scheduled Maintenance". Push enter and select "Yes", and push enter again.

With the hybrid system in operation, switch the multi-information display to the "Settings" screen. Select "Maintenance System". Select "Yes" on the "Oil Maintenance" screen. A message will appear confirming the reset.

To reset, turn the POWER switch to the OFF position with the odometer display showing then turn ON the POWER switch. The display will show the initial screen on the multi-information display for a few seconds. During this time press the TRIP steering switch 3 times and hold on the third until 000000 is shown in the TRIP METER display.

Press the left or right arrow of the meter control to select the "Settings" on the multi-information display. Press the left or right arrows on the meter control. Select "Vehicle Settings", and press the round button. Press the left or right arrows on the meter control, and select "Scheduled Maintenance". Press the round button. Select "Yes", and press the round button.

To reset. With TRIP METER A reading shown in display turn ignition to OFF position. Simultaneously turn ignition to ON position while pressing and holding the TRIP METER RESET button. Continue to press and hold until display shows 000000 (on systems without multi-information displays) or MAINT REQD RESET MODE COMPLETE (on multi-information display systems).

Hold down the odometer and trip display button. Turn the ignition to the "Lock" position. While pressing the odometer and trip display button, switch the ignition to the "On" position. Continue to press and hold the button till the display reads "000000" and the display says the reset is done. If the display is color, switch the multi-information display to the "Settings" screen with the engine running. Then select "Maintenance Reset". Select "Yes". The display will show "Maintenance Reset Complete" once the procedure is finished.

To reset OIL, start vehicle and set the display to TRIP METER A. Turn engine OFF. Press and hold the reset button on the trip meter while turning the ENGINE START STOP switch to ON without starting the engine. Continue to hold button until 000000 is shown on the display.

To reset OIL, start vehicle and set the display to TRIP METER A. Turn engine OFF. Press and hold the reset button on the trip meter while turning the ENGINE START STOP switch to ON without starting the engine. Continue to hold button until 000000 is shown on the display.

Use the trip "Odo/Trip" button to select "Trip A", and then turn the ignition off. Hold the "Odo/Trip" button and turn the ignition on, and continue holding while the display shows "Resetting Maintenance Data".

Use the trip "Odo/Trip" button to select "Trip A", and then turn the ignition off. Hold the "Odo/Trip" button and turn the ignition on, and continue holding while the display shows "Resetting Maintenance Data".

With the engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A and the turn the engine switch to LOCK. Press and hold the display change button and without starting the engine turn the engine switch to ON. Continue to hold the button until 000000 is displayed in the TRIP METER.

With the ignition off, hold the selector button in the upper right side of the instrument panel. Switch the ignition on while still holding down the selector button. Continue to hold the button down for more than five seconds. The light will flash for a few seconds once the reset is complete.

To reset turn the ignition to OFF and press and hold the O.D./SET button while turning the ignition to ON then release the button. the instrument cluster display will show a confirmation request. Press OK on the steering wheel or the button on the bottom of the windshield wiper lever to confirm. The system is now being reset and the normal display will be displayed after a brief period.

Release the button to put it in reset mode. Push the "0.0" button quickly again, and the procedure should be completed.

Turn the ignition to position "1", and push and hold the "Ok" button on the left side of the steering wheel. Turn the ignition to position "2", and wait 10 seconds. The information button should start to flash, and then the button should be released.

Turn the ignition to position "1", and push and hold the "Ok" button on the left side of the steering wheel. Turn the ignition to position "2", and wait 10 seconds. The information button should start to flash, and then the button should be released.

Without pressing any pedals, turn the start knob to "Start" and set the vehicle mode to "Convenience". Push the decrease cruise control button "-" on the left key pad of the steering wheel, and continue to hold it down. Set the usage mode to "Driving" by turning on the vehicle. The information symbol should flash after holding the cruise control button for 10 seconds. Release the cruise control button no later than four seconds after the information symbol starts flashing.

With the power mode ON go to the MAINTENANCE INFO group and press the right selector wheel to display the OIL LIFE RESET on the multi-information display. Using the right selector wheel, select RESET and then push in the right selector wheel to reset the OIL LIFE display to 100%. The displayed maintenance items will disappear.
Scroll to "Vehicle Settings" and select it in the menu. Then scroll to "Maintenance Info" and select it in the menu, and the oil life will be displayed. Select "Reset" to change the oil life to 100%.

Engine Oil: 5W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula or 0W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset service displays turn the ignition to the ON position. NOTE: (ALWAYS reset OIL SERVICE before resetting any other service job). Press and hold RESET on the ODOMETER until the display shows OIL SERVICE. RESET EXECUTABLE will be displayed if a reset is possible. Press ODOMETER RESET button (about 3 seconds) until display shows EXECUTE RESET. Press RESET again for about 3 seconds to confirm. During reset display will show RESET RUNNING and then RESET COMPLETE when system is reset. REpeat above procedure to to reset other services needed.

To reset turn ignition to ON. Display service jobs by pressing the TRIP ODOMETER button for 10 seconds. Select the desired job by pressing the button again from the menu. It will be the oil can icon in the upper display. Time or distance remaining until next service will be shown in the lower display. Press and hold the button for 3 seconds or until display shows RESET? then press the button again for 3 seconds to confirm.

Oil Plug Torque: Engine Code N63B44B 18 ft. lbs. or Engine Code S63R 15 ft. lbs.
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset turn ignition to ON. Display service jobs by pressing the TRIP ODOMETER button for 10 seconds. Select the desired job by pressing the button again from the menu. It will be the oil can icon in the upper display. Time or distance remaining until next service will be shown in the lower display. Press and hold the button for 3 seconds or until display shows RESET? then press the button again for 3 seconds to confirm.

With the ignition switch in the ON position, press and hold the TRIP DISTANCE RECORDER RESET button until the LCD display shows the 1st scope of maintenance work or for about 10 seconds. On the speedometer the UPPER DISPLAY is illuminated by a service symbol. An oil change is denoted by and OIL CAN. The time or distance remaining until next service is shown in the lower speedometer display. Use the rocker switch on the turn signal high beam switch to set the desired maintenance scope. Press the on-board computer button on the turn signal /high beam switch and hold until until RESET appears and then press and hold again to confirm.

On the speedometer the UPPER DISPLAY is illuminated by a service symbol. An oil change is denoted by and OIL CAN. The time or distance remaining until next service is shown in the lower speedometer display. Use the rocker switch on the turn signal high beam switch to set the desired maintenance scope. Press the on-board computer button on the turn signal /high beam switch and hold until until RESET appears and then press and hold again to confirm.

Turn the ignition on, and push the "Menu" button on the turn signal switch. Using the selection wheel, scroll to "Oil Life Reset". Push the "Set/Clr" button on the turn signal switch and push the brake pedal at the same time.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. To reset show the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the display by pressing the MENU button. Press the SET/CLEAR button while the display is active the reset the engine oil life system. A single chime will sound after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

Without starting the engine, turn the ignition key to the ON position. For vehicles with push button start: Without attempting to start the engine and without pressing the brake pedal, press and hold the START/STOP button for 2 seconds. Simultaneously press and hold both the brake and accelerator pedals until the display shows SERVICE: OIL RESET IN PROG then after about 25 seconds SERVICE: OIL RESET COMPLETE. Release both pedals and the OIL RESET message will go away. Turn the key to OFF. On push button start vehicles press the START/STOP button to completely turn off vehicle.

To reset, navigate through the message center using the left steering wheel controls. Move through the message center choices using the UP/DOWN buttons then use the LEFT/RIGHT arrow buttons to select OIL LIFE RESET and select set to 100%. To confirm press OK and the system will display SETTING and then SETTING COMPLETE when the reset is finished.

To reset access the main menu on the message center. Select the SETTINGS tab by scrolling the UP and DOWN arrow buttons then press OK. Select the VEHICLE tab using the UP and DOWN arrow buttons then scroll to OIL LIFE RESET and reset by pressing and holding the OK button.
Turn the ignition on. Press and hold the "Trip" button. Continue holding down the "Trip" button for more than five seconds until the light flashes.

This may be reset in one of two ways depending on gauge cluster. Press and hold the "Trip" button with the ignition off. Then switch the ignition on while still holding the "Trip" button for more than five seconds. The warning light will flash when the reset is done. For the other way to reset the maintenance reminder, switch the ignition on. Then select the "A" icon on the display to show "Applications". Select "Maintenance", and then switch the tab for the setting that needs to be changed. Once the "Oil Change" tab is selected it resets oil life to 100%.

Select "Maintenance", and then switch the tab for the setting that needs to be changed. Once the "Oil Change" tab is selected it resets oil life to 100%.
Start with the ignition off. Hold down the dashboard illumination switch and switch the ignition on while continuing to hold the button. Press and hold this button for seven seconds.

Reset 1: Push and hold the illumination knob while the ignition is off. Continue to press the illumination knob for more than five seconds. The warning light should flash when the procedure is complete. Reset 2: Go to the "Applications" screen, and select "Maintenance". Select the item you want to reset by switching the tab.

Make sure hood and all doors are closed. Insert key into ignition and turn to position "1". Press the system select button until the "Trip" is highlighted in the display, and push the "OK" button. Use the forward and back scrolling button until "Total Distance" is displayed in the "Trip" menu. Within five seconds of the "Total Distance" message appearing, hold down the "Accept Phone Call" button, and push the "OK" button within one second. Continue holding for five seconds. Once the shop menu is displayed, select "Assyst Plus" using the "OK" button. Select "Service Data", and push the "OK" button. Push the scroll back button until "Full Service" can be highlighted, and press "OK". Push the scroll back button until "Confirm Serv" is reached, and push the "OK" button.

To reset, make sure that doors, hood, and trunk lids are closed then turn the key to the 1 position. The multifunction display should show the standard display. If it does not, repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to select the standard display. Repeatedly press the system selection button until TRIP is highlighted in the display and remains for 5 seconds. Immediately within that 5 seconds press and hold the ACCEPT AND END PHONE CALL button and within 1 second press and hold OK.The workshop menu with the tabs VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMNETER TEST, CHANGE BRAKE PADS, AND ASSYST PLUS will show in the multifuntion display. Repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select and highlight the ASSYST PLUS tab then press OK to confirm. The multifunction display will show SERVICE DATA AND FULL SERVICE. Select and highlight FULL SERVICE by pressing the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. CONFIRM SERV and other current service items will be shown in the display. Select and highlight CONFIRM SERV using the FORWARD and BACKWARD scroll button and press OK to confirm. The display will show the ENGINE OIL SELECTION. Use the FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select the oil specification and press OK to confirm. Oil selected and SERV CONDUCTED? will be shown in the multifunction display. Select and highlight YES using the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. TAKE BACK NOT POSSIBLE, CONFIRM, and CANCEL TABS WILL SHOW IN THE MULTIFUNCTION DISPLAY. Select and highlight the configuration using the scroll buttons and press OK to confirm. When display will shows FULL SERVICE CARRIED OUT press OK. Press BACK and VCS OFF button repeatedly until the standard display is shown and turn the key to 0.

Make sure all doors, hood, and trunk are closed, and turn the ignition to position "1". Use the finger pad navigation to select the "Trip" menu on the display. Swipe using the finger navigation pad once in the "Trip" menu to select "Total Distance" on the display. Push the "Back" button until the workshop entry menu shows in the display.

Use the FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select the oil specification and press OK to confirm. Oil selected and SERV CONDUCTED? will be shown in the multifunction display. Select and highlight YES using the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. TAKE BACK NOT POSSIBLE, CONFIRM, and CANCEL TABS WILL SHOW IN THE MULTIFUNCTION DISPLAY. Select and highlight the configuration using the scroll buttons and press OK to confirm. When display will shows FULL SERVICE CARRIED OUT press OK. Press BACK and VCS OFF button repeatedly until the standard display is shown and turn the key to 0.

Oil Capacity: All Wheel Drive . 6.5 liters Rear Wheel Drive . 7.0 liters with filter
Oil Life Reset Instructions: Make sure hood and all doors are closed. Insert key into ignition and turn to position "1". Press the system select button until the "Trip" is highlighted in the display, and push the "OK" button. Use the forward and back scrolling button until "Total Distance" is displayed in the "Trip" menu. Within five seconds of the "Total Distance" message appearing, hold down the "Accept Phone Call" button, and push the "OK" button within one second. Continue holding for five seconds. Once the shop menu is displayed, select "Assyst Plus" using the "OK" button. Select "Service Data", and push the "OK" button. Push the scroll back button until "Full Service" can be highlighted, and press "OK". Push the scroll back button until "Confirm Serv" is reached, and push the "OK" button.

Make sure all doors, hood and trunk are closed. Switch the ignition to position "2". In order to perform the reset, there cannot be any fault messages showing in the display. Make sure all doors are closed, and turn the ignition to position "1". Press the system selection button until "Trip" is highlighted. Push and hold the "Accept Call" button, and then press and hold the "OK" button for about five seconds. Push the scroll forward button until "Assyst Plus" is highlighted, and push the "OK" button. Push the scroll forward to show the remaining distance and oil data. Press the "Exit" menu button until the display appears. To reset the service data, turn the ignition key to position "2". Push the system selection button until the workshop menu shows "Vehicle Data", "Dynamoter Test", and "Assyst Plus" in the display. Push the scroll forward button until "Full Service" is highlighted, and push "OK". Select the engine oil used with the scroll forward button, and push "OK". Push the scroll forward button until "Yes" is highlighted, and push "OK".

To reset make sure that doors, hood, and trunk lid are closed. Turn the key to the 1 position and make sure that the multi-function display shows the standard display. To reset make sure that doors, engine hood and trunk lid or lift gate are closed then place key in the ignition and turn switch to the 1 position. the multifunction display should show the MILEAGE COUNTER. If it does not repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD/BACK button on the left down arrow to display the mileage counter. Highlight the TRIP menu item by pressing the system selection button or left arrow button. The TRIP menu will stay highlighted for 5 seconds. Press and hold the ACCEPT PHONE CALL button and press and hold the the OK button within 1 second. Continue to hold both buttons for 5 seconds. VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMETER TEST, AND ASSYST PLUS will be displayed on the WORKSHOP menu in the multifuntion display. Select the ASSYST PLUS menu by pressing and scrolling the FORWARD/BACK BUTTON. . To confirm press the n button.The multifunction display will now show SERVICE DATA and FULL SERVICE. Highlight FULL SERVICE using the scroll FORWARD/BACK button and confirm by pressing OK. The multifunction display will show the current service items. Highlight CONFIRM SERVICE by scrolling the FORWARD/BACK button and press OK to confirm. OIL SELECTION or SERVICE CARRIED OUT will show in the display. Use the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to select the specification the the engine oil and press OK to confirm. Select YES by scrolling forward and press n to confirm.The multifunction display will then show NO TAKE BACK POSSIBLE.

Note: It is only possible to get into the service menu if the readout in the display is shown as km. If the vehicle has exceeded the maintenance interval wait until km are shown in the display. Turn the ignition to the ON position. On the instrument cluster press the 0 button for 30 seconds and a beep will sound. For GASOLINE ENGINES: For engines that have a long oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display with the OIL CAN symbol show rESEt229.5. For engines that have a short oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display shows rESEt229.3. On the instrument cluster, press the O button for 3 seconds, release then press 0 again and turn the ignition OFF/ON. Press and hold the 0 button again for 30 secondsor until you hear a beep. Press and hold the M button until the display shows rESEt StoP and the OIL CAN symbol. Press and hold the 0 button for 3 seconds, release, and the press again. For DIESEL ENGINES; For engines with a long oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display shows rESEt.51. Older clusters will have the display rESEt229.5 and an OIL CAN symbol. For engines with a short oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display shows rESEt.31. Older clusters will have the display rESEt229.3 and an OIL CAN symbol.

Turn the ignition to the ON position. On the instrument cluster press the 0 button for 30 seconds and a beep will sound. For GASOLINE ENGINES: For engines that have a long oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display with the OIL CAN symbol show rESEt229.5. For engines that have a short oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display shows rESEt229.3. On the instrument cluster, press the O button for 3 seconds, release then press 0 again and turn the ignition OFF/ON. Press and hold the 0 button again for 30 secondsor until you hear a beep. Press and hold the M button until the display shows rESEt StoP and the OIL CAN symbol. Press and hold the 0 button for 3 seconds, release, and the press again. For DIESEL ENGINES; For engines with a long oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display shows rESEt.51. Older clusters will have the display rESEt229.5 and an OIL CAN symbol. For engines with a short oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display shows rESEt.31. Older clusters will have the display rESEt229.3 and an OIL CAN symbol.

To reset turn the ignition switch to ON. To access the SERVICE SCOPE X in XXX KM menu the total kilometers must be displayed. If the display does not show the total kilometers press the SYSTEM SELECTION button on the steering wheel in the lower control panel until the display shows the total kilometers. Repeatedly press the UPPER CONTROL PANEL on the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to display SERVICE SCOPE X IN XXX KM. On the instrument cluster press and hold the 0 button until you hear a beep and then press the SYSTEM SELECTION button on the LOWER CONTROL PANEL once. To display SERVICE IN XXX KM in the multifunction display press the UPPER CONTROL PANEL of the SCROLL FORWARD/BACK button. on the instrument cluster press the 0 button and the menu CARRY OUT will be displayed. To display the selection menu OIL TYPES press the UPPER CONTROL panel of the SCROLL FORWARD/BACK button. On the UPPER repeatedly press the + and - button to select the desired oil type and then use the SCROLL FORWARD/BACK button in the UPPER CONTROL PANEL to select MARK OIL TYPE. On the instrument cluster press the 0 button for 3 seconds to display SERVICE CONFIRMED then press 0 again to display CARRY OUT and use the + and - on the UPPER CONTROL PANEL to mark the FULL SERVICE BACK menu.

Note: It is only possible to get into the service menu if the readout in the display is shown as km. If the vehicle has exceeded the maintenance interval wait until km are shown in the display. For GASOLINE ENGINES: For engines that have a long oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display with the OIL CAN symbol show rESEt229.5. For engines that have a short oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display shows rESEt229.3. On the instrument cluster, press the O button for 3 seconds, release then press 0 again and turn the ignition OFF/ON. Press and hold the 0 button again for 30 secondsor until you hear a beep. Press and hold the M button until the display shows rESEt StoP and the OIL CAN symbol. Press and hold the 0 button for 3 seconds, release, and the press again. For DIESEL ENGINES; For engines with a long oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display shows rESEt.51. Older clusters will have the display rESEt229.5 and an OIL CAN symbol. For engines with a short oil change interval repeatedly press the M button until the display shows rESEt.31. Older clusters will have the display rESEt229.3 and an OIL CAN symbol.

To reset, turn ON the ignition and press and hold the TRIP DISTANCE RECORDER RESET button for about 10 seconds or until the display show the first service job. Select the desired service job by briefly pressing the button again to scroll through the different jobs. RESET POSSIBLE will be shown in the display if a reset is possible and reset is started by pressing and holding the button for 3 seconds. The display will show a progress bar and in text as RESET IN PROGRESS to show the system status. RESET SUCCESSFUL will be displayed when reset is confirmed.

Turn on terminal 15. Push the trip/odometer/reset button for about 10 seconds. A service job should appear in the display. An oil can symbol should light up in the upper display. The lower display should show the time or distance until next service. Push the computer button to scroll. Push and hold the computer button to reset the service shown in the upper display.

Oil Capacity: With Manual Transmission . 4.6 liters . Without Manual Transmission . 4.3 liters with filter

Oil Life Reset Instructions: Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON position. On the left side of the display press the square button to display the SETTINGS mode. To display MAINTENANCE, press the circular button until MAINTENANCE is highlighted then press the circular button to set desired interval and press the square button to open the RESET mode. Enter desired distance and select RESET. Enter desired time or distance then repeat the steps to reset ENGINE OIL FILTER.

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

On the display select OIL, FILTER on the maintenance screen and use the following items to input the maintenance distance. To change the mileage press the NEXT switch 0 then press and hold to increase every 600 miles of 1,000km. To set no reminders set to "_". Go to the RESET screen and press NEXT screen to reset the accumulated mileage to zero and press the the square enter switch to confirm.

Oil Capacity: NISMO . 4.5 liters . NISMO RS . 4.3 liters with filter

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset use the NISSAN controller to display the screen to change the maintenance interval and select one of the reminder keys ENGINE OIL, OIL FILTER reminder. Using the NISSAN controller select the interval key to change the maintenance interval. Press the BACK button to accept the changes. Using the NISSAN controller select the RESET DISTANCE key to reset the reminder schedule distance to 0 mi.
Go to the message center menu. Use the left and right arrow buttons to scroll to and select the "Maintenance Tab". Scroll down to the "Oil Life Reset", and press and hold the "Ok" button.

To reset rotate the INFO knob in the lower left corner of the cluster next to the speedometer to select settings. To reset ENGINE OIL, filter distance setting reminder maintenance indicator, press knob to select and change the maintenance selection .

To reset rotate the INFO knob in the lower left corner of the cluster next to the speedometer to select settings. To reset ENGINE OIL, filter distance setting reminder maintenance indicator, press knob to select and change the maintenance selection .

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON position. On the left side of the display press the square button to display the SETTINGS mode. To display MAINTENANCE, press the circular button until MAINTENANCE is highlighted then press the circular button to set desired interval and press the square button to open the RESET mode. Enter desired distance and select RESET. Enter desired time or distance then repeat the steps to reset ENGINE OIL FILTER.

Use the "Enter" button and directional arrows on the vehicle information display. Select "Settings", then "Maintenance", and then "Oil and Filter". In this menu, the maintenance interval can be changed or reset.

Engine Oil: 10W-30 Synthetic Diesel Oil or 5W-40 Synthetic Diesel Oil
Oil Life Reset Instructions: Use the "Enter" button and directional arrows on the vehicle information display. Select "Settings", then "Maintenance", and then "Oil and Filter". In this menu, the maintenance interval can be changed or reset.

To reset, turn the ignition to the ON position and and press the TRIP COMPUTER CHANGE button near the speedometer on the instrument panel for about 3 seconds to display the OIL CHANGE INFORMATION and WRENCH symbol then the distance to oil change interval mile schedule can be adjusted.

To reset, turn the ignition to the ON position and and press the TRIP COMPUTER CHANGE button near the speedometer on the instrument panel for about 3 seconds to display the OIL CHANGE INFORMATION and WRENCH symbol then the distance to oil change interval mile schedule can be adjusted.

To reset cycle the ignition to the ON/RUN position without starting the engine and without pressing on the brake pedal. Scroll downward through the MAIN MENU to the VEHICLE INFO menu by pressing and releasing the DOWN arrow button. To access the OIL LIFE screen press and release the RIGHT arrow button. Access the the OIL LIFE RESET screen by pressing and holding the RIGHT arrow button for 1 second. Select YES by pressing and releasing the DOWN arrow button. To select reset of OIL LIFE press and release the Right arrow button. Exit the EXIC screen by pressing and releasing the UP arrow button.

To reset cycle the ignition to the ON/RUN position without starting the engine or pressing on the brake pedal. Slowly but fully depress the accelerator pedal 3 times in less than 10 seconds then cycle ignition to OFF/LOCK.

To reset cycle the ignition to the ON/RUN position without starting the engine or pressing on the brake pedal. Slowly but fully depress the accelerator pedal 3 times in less than 10 seconds then cycle ignition to OFF/LOCK.

To reset cycle the ignition to the ON/RUN position without starting the engine or pressing on the brake pedal. Slowly but fully depress the accelerator pedal 3 times in less than 10 seconds then cycle ignition to OFF/LOCK.

To reset cycle the ignition to the ON/RUN position without starting the engine or pressing on the brake pedal. Slowly but fully depress the accelerator pedal 3 times in less than 10 seconds then cycle ignition to OFF/LOCK.

To reset cycle the ignition to the ON/RUN position without starting the engine or pressing on the brake pedal. Slowly but fully depress the accelerator pedal 3 times in less than 10 seconds then cycle ignition to OFF/LOCK.

With the ignition off, hold the selector button in the upper right side of the instrument panel. Switch the ignition on while still holding down the selector button. Continue to hold the button down for more than five seconds. The light will flash for a few seconds once the reset is complete.

With TRIP A reading shown turn the Ignition to OFF. Press and hold the ODO/TRIP button while turning the ignition to ON. Continue to hold the button for at least 5 seconds or until the indicator flashes and the bars in the odometer display disappear, the light goes off, and the odometer shows 000000. Repeat the procedure if the light continues to flash.

Engine Oil: 5W-30 Synthetic European Car Formula or 5W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula
Oil Life Reset Instructions: With ignition in the ON position select SERVICE INDICATOR on the instrument cluster in the multifunction display.On the left side of the instrument cluster press the lower button 2 times within 4 seconds then within 10 seconds turn OFF the igniton. On the left side of the cluster press and hold the lower button while turning the ignition to the On position and the SERVICE INDICATOR display flashes and goes to 0 then button may be release and ignition turned to the OFF position.

Push the up and down arrow switch below the emergency flasher to select the maintenance menu, and press "Enter". Set the oil change interval, and press the "Enter" button. The same procedure is done to set the filter change interval.

Push the up and down arrow switch below the emergency flasher to select the maintenance menu, and press "Enter". Set the oil change interval, and press the "Enter" button. The same procedure is done to set the filter change interval.
To reset turn the engine switch to IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) while pressing and holding the display change button until the TRIP meter shows 000000.

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.

Automatic Transmission Fluid: WS or Synthetic CVT for CVT
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset turn the engine switch to IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) while pressing and holding the display change button until the TRIP meter shows 000000.

With TRIP METER A reading shown turn the engine switch OFF. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button and without starting the engine turn the ignition switch to the ON position and continue to hold until 000000 is displayed on the TRIP METER.

With TRIP METER A reading shown turn the engine switch OFF. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button and without starting the engine turn the ignition switch to the ON position and continue to hold until 000000 is displayed on the TRIP METER.

Push the left or right arrow of the meter control switch, and select the gear symbol. Push the up and down arrow of the meter control switch, and select "Scheduled Maintenance". Push enter and select "Yes", and push enter again.

With the hybrid system in operation, switch the multi-information display to the "Settings" screen. Select "Maintenance System". Select "Yes" on the "Oil Maintenance" screen. A message will appear confirming the reset.

To reset, turn the POWER switch to the OFF position with the odometer display showing then turn ON the POWER switch. The display will show the initial screen on the multi-information display for a few seconds. During this time press the TRIP steering switch 3 times and hold on the third until 000000 is shown in the TRIP METER display.

For a vehicle with "Non-Color Display", Switch the display to trip A and switch the ignition to the "Lock" position. Hold the "DISP" button and ignition to "ON" without starting the engine. Continue holding the "DISP" button until it reads "000000". For vehicles with "Color Display", press the left or right arrow buttons of the meter control. Select the star symbol on the multi-information display. Press the up or down keys of the meter control, and select "Meter Settings". Press the round button. Then press the up or down keys of the meter control and select "Scheduled Maintenance". Press the round button. Select "Yes", and press the round button.

To reset. With TRIP METER A reading shown in display turn ignition to OFF position. Simultaneously turn ignition to ON position while pressing and holding the TRIP METER RESET button. Continue to press and hold until display shows 000000 (on systems without multi-information displays) or MAINT REQD RESET MODE COMPLETE (on multi-information display systems).

Hold down the odometer and trip display button. Turn the ignition to the "Lock" position. While pressing the odometer and trip display button, switch the ignition to the "On" position. Continue to press and hold the button till the display reads "000000" and the display says the reset is done. If the display is color, switch the multi-information display to the "Settings" screen with the engine running. Then select "Maintenance Reset". Select "Yes". The display will show "Maintenance Reset Complete" once the procedure is finished.

To reset OIL, start vehicle and set the display to TRIP METER A. Turn engine OFF. Press and hold the reset button on the trip meter while turning the ENGINE START STOP switch to ON without starting the engine. Continue to hold button until 000000 is shown on the display.

To reset OIL, start vehicle and set the display to TRIP METER A. Turn engine OFF. Press and hold the reset button on the trip meter while turning the ENGINE START STOP switch to ON without starting the engine. Continue to hold button until 000000 is shown on the display.

Use the trip "Odo/Trip" button to select "Trip A", and then turn the ignition off. Hold the "Odo/Trip" button and turn the ignition on, and continue holding while the display shows "Resetting Maintenance Data".

Use the trip "Odo/Trip" button to select "Trip A", and then turn the ignition off. Hold the "Odo/Trip" button and turn the ignition on, and continue holding while the display shows "Resetting Maintenance Data".

With the engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A and the turn the engine switch to LOCK. Press and hold the display change button and without starting the engine turn the engine switch to ON. Continue to hold the button until 000000 is displayed in the TRIP METER.

Engine Oil: 5W-40 European Car Formula or 0W-40 European Car Formula
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset turn the ignition to OFF and press and hold the O.D./SET button while turning the ignition to ON then release the button. the instrument cluster display will show a confirmation request. Press OK on the steering wheel or the button on the bottom of the windshield wiper lever to confirm. The system is now being reset and the normal display will be displayed after a brief period.

Without pressing any pedals, turn the start knob to "Start" and set the vehicle mode to "Convenience". The maintenance codes will disappear on the display and OIL LIFE will be reset to 100%.

To reset, select OIL LIFE using the SELECT knob on the DIC menu. To start the OIL LIFE reset procedure press SELECT and ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO RESET will appear on the DIC menu. Choose YES using the SELECT button and RESET OIL LIFE and then 100% OIL LIFE will be displayed in the DEC menu.
To reset display OIL LIFE REMAINING by pressing the DIC vehicle information button. Reset the OIL LIFE to 100% by pressing and holding the DIC SET/RESET button for 5 seconds.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

To reset show the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the display by pressing the MENU button. Press the SET/CLEAR button while the display is active the reset the engine oil life system. A single chime will sound after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

Without starting the engine, turn the ignition key to the ON position. For vehicles with push button start: Without attempting to start the engine and without pressing the brake pedal, press and hold the START/STOP button for 2 seconds. Simultaneously press and hold both the brake and accelerator pedals until the display shows SERVICE: OIL RESET IN PROG then after about 25 seconds SERVICE: OIL RESET COMPLETE. Release both pedals and the OIL RESET message will go away. Turn the key to OFF. On push button start vehicles press the START/STOP button to completely turn off vehicle.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition switch to the ON position. On push button start engines, without pressing the brake pedal and without starting the vehicle, press and hold the start button for 2 seconds. Fully press and hold both brake and accelerator pedals. Brake and accelerator pedals can now be released.

Hold until RESETTING SERVICE MODE and then after 10 seconds SERVICE MODE RESET is shown in the message center display. Release switches and turn OFF ignition.

Select the SERVICE MENU by pressing the directional buttons and select the last menu option. Press and hold both the TRIP and DOWN directional buttons for 10 seconds to reset the service indicator message the turn the ignition to the OFF position. Repeat the process if the message has not been cleared when the ignition is turned back to ON.

Repeat the procedure if the message has not cleared when the ignition is turned back to the ON position.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset, make sure that doors, hood, and trunk lids are closed then turn the key to the 1 position. The multifunction display should show the standard display. If it does not, repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to select the standard display. Repeatedly press the system selection button until TRIP is highlighted in the display and remains for 5 seconds. Immediately within that 5 seconds press and hold the ACCEPT AND END PHONE CALL button and within 1 second press and hold OK.The workshop menu with the tabs VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMNETER TEST, CHANGE BRAKE PADS, AND ASSYST PLUS will show in the multifuntion display. Repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select and highlight the ASSYST PLUS tab then press OK to confirm. The multifunction display will show SERVICE DATA AND FULL SERVICE. Select and highlight FULL SERVICE by pressing the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. CONFIRM SERV and other current service items will be shown in the display. Select and highlight CONFIRM SERV using the FORWARD and BACKWARD scroll button and press OK to confirm. The display will show the ENGINE OIL SELECTION. Use the FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select the oil specification and press OK to confirm. Oil selected and SERV CONDUCTED? will be shown in the multifunction display. Select and highlight YES using the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. TAKE BACK NOT POSSIBLE, CONFIRM, and CANCEL TABS WILL SHOW IN THE MULTIFUNCTION DISPLAY. Select and highlight the configuration using the scroll buttons and press OK to confirm. When display will shows FULL SERVICE CARRIED OUT press OK. Press BACK and VCS OFF button repeatedly until the standard display is shown and turn the key to 0.

CARRIED OUT? will show in the display. Select and confirm engine oil specification on vehicles with engine 272,273 then scroll forward to highlight YES and press OK to confirm. Oil Life Reset Instructions: Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON position. On the left side of the display press the square button to display the SETTINGS mode. To display MAINTENANCE, press the circular button until MAINTENANCE is highlighted then press the circular button to set desired interval and press the square button to open the RESET mode. Enter desired distance and select RESET. Enter desired time or distance then repeat the steps to reset ENGINE OIL FILTER.

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

To reset use the NISSAN controller to select the MAINTENANCE key by pressing the INFO button. The display screen will show the maintenance information. Use the NIssan controller to select one of the maintenance reminder keys to change the interval schedule. Select ENGINE OIL, OIL FILTER, TIRE or other reminders and touch + or - keys to choose the desired distance. Press the BACK button to accept the changes. Select the RESET DISTANCE key using the NISSAN controller to reset the reminder schedule distance to 0 mi or km.

On the display select OIL, FILTER on the maintenance screen and use the following items to input the maintenance distance. To change the mileage press the NEXT switch 0 then press and hold to increase every 600 miles of 1,000km. To set no reminders set to "_". Go to the RESET screen and press NEXT screen to reset the accumulated mileage to zero and press the the square enter switch to confirm.

OIL REPLACEMENT REMINDER light can be reset by turning OFF ignition switch with with odometer reading showing and turning the ignition ON while pressing the ODO/TRIP button. Hold button until odometer reads 000000 (about 5 seconds) and the light turns off. If the light continues to flash the system has not reset and the procedure should be repeated.

With the engine running switch the display to the TRIP METER then turn the engine switch to LOCK. Press and hold the MODE button while turning the engine switch ON without starting the engine. System should be reset.

Engine Oil: 5W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula or 0W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula
Oil Life Reset Instructions: With ignition in the ON position select SERVICE INDICATOR on the instrument cluster in the multifunction display.On the left side of the instrument cluster press the lower button 2 times within 4 seconds then within 10 seconds turn OFF the igniton. On the left side of the cluster press and hold the lower button while turning the ignition to the On position and the SERVICE INDICATOR display flashes and goes to 0 then button may be release and ignition turned to the OFF position.
To reset turn the engine switch to IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) while pressing and holding the display change button until the TRIP meter shows 000000.

OIL REPLACEMENT REMINDER light can be reset by turning OFF ignition switch with with odometer reading showing and turning the ignition ON while pressing the ODO/TRIP button. Hold button until odometer reads 000000 (about 5 seconds) and the light turns off. If the light continues to flash the system has not reset and the procedure should be repeated.

OIL REPLACEMENT REMINDER light can be reset by turning OFF ignition switch with with odometer reading showing and turning the ignition ON while pressing the ODO/TRIP button. Hold button until odometer reads 000000 (about 5 seconds) and the light turns off. If the light continues to flash the system has not reset and the procedure should be repeated.

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.
To reset turn the engine switch to IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) while pressing and holding the display change button until the TRIP meter shows 000000.

With TRIP METER A reading shown turn the engine switch OFF. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button and without starting the engine turn the ignition switch to the ON position and continue to hold until 000000 is displayed on the TRIP METER.

With TRIP METER A reading shown turn the engine switch OFF. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button and without starting the engine turn the ignition switch to the ON position and continue to hold until 000000 is displayed on the TRIP METER.

To reset turn the engine switch OFF with the display set at TRIP METER A. Press and hold the DISP button and without starting the engine turn the engine switch to IGNITION ON. Continue to hold the button until 000000 is displayed in the TRIP METER.

To reset. With TRIP METER A reading shown in display turn ignition to OFF position. Simultaneously turn ignition to ON position while pressing and holding the TRIP METER RESET button. Continue to press and hold until display shows 000000 (on systems without multi-information displays) or MAINT REQD RESET MODE COMPLETE (on multi-information display systems).

To reset turn the ENGINE START STOP to the OFF position and set the TRIP METER reading to A. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET while turning the the ENGINE START STOP to IGNITION ON. Continue holding RESET until the TRIP METER display shows 000000 on vehicles without multifunction information display or COMPLETE is displayed on vehicles with multifunction information display.

Oil Capacity: Wheel Drive . 43.1 liters . Rear Wheel Drive . 4.5 liters with filter

Oil Life Reset Instructions: With TRIP METER A reading shown in the display turn the engine switch to OFF. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button and turn the engine switch to ON. If the vehicle does not have multi-information display continue to hold the RESET button until 000000 is displayed on the TRIP METER. For vehicles with multi-information display, continue to hold RESET until the display shows the message RESETTING MAINTENANCE DATA.

With TRIP METER A reading shown in the display turn the engine switch to OFF. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button and turn the engine switch to ON. If the vehicle does not have multi-information display continue to hold the RESET button until 000000 is displayed on the TRIP METER. For vehicles with multi-information display, continue to hold RESET until the display shows the message RESETTING MAINTENANCE DATA.

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.

With the engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A and the turn the engine switch to LOCK. Press and hold the display change button and without starting the engine turn the engine switch to ON. Continue to hold the button until 000000 is displayed in the TRIP METER.

To reset, turn OFF the ignition and press and hold the O.D./SET button while turning the ignition ON. Within 20 seconds release the O.D. button and press the button to the left of the O.D./SET button to place the service interval in RESET mode. The display will return to the normal display.

Engine Oil: 5W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula or 0W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To manually reset the SERVICE INTERVAL check that the vehicle is coded for fixed intervals. Select the SETTINGS menu using the rocker switch or multi function switch and select RESET in the SERVICE menu, press OK and then press OK again to confirm. If using the instrument cluster turn the ignition OFF, then press and hold the SET button while turning ON the ignition. Release SET and then press again briefly to set the clock. The display will be in reset mode and will switch back to the normal display when reset is complete.

To reset select the ON mode by pressing the engine START/STOP button. Press the INFO button to cancel the display if system messages are displayed. Use the INFO button to select CUSTOMIZE SETTING and the press SEL/RESET. Use the INFO button to select MAINTENANCE INFO then press SEL/RESET. The multi-information display will now show the OIL LIFE RESET mode. Select RESET by pressing the INFO button and then press SEL/RESET. The maintenance codes will disappear on the display and OIL LIFE will be reset to 100%.

The multi-information display will now show the OIL LIFE RESET mode. Select RESET by pressing the INFO button and then press SEL/RESET. The maintenance codes will disappear on the display and OIL LIFE will be reset to 100%.

To reset switch ON the power mode and push the multi-function steering wheel controls to go to the MAINTENANCE INFO group. ON the MID the display will show the OIL LIFE RESET mode. Use the steering wheel controls to select RESET and then press the multi-function steering wheel control to reset OIL LIFE to 100%.

The multi-information display will now show the OIL LIFE RESET mode. Select RESET by pressing the INFO button and then press SEL/RESET. With the power mode ON go to the MAINTENANCE INFO group and press the right selector wheel to display the OIL LIFE RESET on the multi-information display. Using the right selector wheel, select RESET and then push in the right selector wheel to reset the OIL LIFE display to 100%. The displayed maintenance items will disappear.

To reset press the start/stop button to select ON or turn ignition switch to ON position and press INFO button to cancel message display. Repeatedly press and release SEL/RESET button until display shows engine oil life indicator. Continue to hold button until OIL LIFE RESET is displayed (approximately 10 seconds) the press the INFO button , select RESET, then press the SEL/RESET button again to display OIL LIFE 100%.

To reset press the start/stop button to select ON or turn ignition switch to ON position and press INFO button to cancel message display. Repeatedly press and release SEL/RESET button until display shows engine oil life indicator. Continue to hold button until OIL LIFE RESET is displayed (approximately 10 seconds) the press the INFO button , select RESET, then press the SEL/RESET button again to display OIL LIFE 100%.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON position then press and release the SEL/RESET button until the display show the oil life indicator. For about 10 seconds press and hold the SEL/RESET button until OIL LIFE RESET is displayed then press and release the INFO button until the display shows RESET . Press SEL/RESET button. Oil LIfe will reset to 100%.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON position then press and release the SEL/RESET button until the display show the oil life indicator. For about 10 seconds press and hold the SEL/RESET button until OIL LIFE RESET is displayed then press and release the INFO button until the display shows RESET . Press SEL/RESET button. Oil LIfe will reset to 100%.

Engine Oil: 5W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula or 0W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset service displays turn the ignition to the ON position. NOTE: (ALWAYS reset OIL SERVICE before resetting any other service job). Press and hold RESET on the ODOMETER until the display shows OIL SERVICE. RESET EXECUTABLE will be displayed if a reset is possible. Press ODOMETER RESET button (about 3 seconds) until display shows EXECUTE RESET. Press RESET again for about 3 seconds to confirm. During reset display will show RESET RUNNING and then RESET COMPLETE when system is reset. REpeat above procedure to to reset other services needed.

Press and hold RESET on the ODOMETER until the display shows OIL SERVICE. RESET EXECUTABLE will be displayed if a reset is possible. Press ODOMETER RESET button (about 3 seconds) until display shows EXECUTE RESET. Press RESET again for about 3 seconds to confirm. During reset display will show RESET RUNNING and then RESET COMPLETE when system is reset. REpeat above procedure to to reset other services needed.

Engine Oil: 5W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula or 0W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula
Oil Capacity: All Wheel Drive . 5.5 liters . Rear Wheel Drive . 5.0 liters with filter
Oil Plug Torque: Rear Wheel Drive 6 ft. lbs. All Wheel Drive 18 ft. lbs.
Oil Life Reset Instructions: With the ignition switch in the ON position, press and hold the TRIP DISTANCE RECORDER RESET button until the LCD display shows the 1st scope of maintenance work or for about 10 seconds. On the speedometer the UPPER DISPLAY is illuminated by a service symbol. An oil change is denoted by and OIL CAN. The time or distance remaining until next service is shown in the lower speedometer display. Use the rocker switch on the turn signal high beam switch to set the desired maintenance scope. Press the on-board computer button on the turn signal /high beam switch and hold until until RESET appears and then press and hold again to confirm.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset turn ignition to ON. Display service jobs by pressing the TRIP ODOMETER button for 10 seconds. Select the desired job by pressing the button again from the menu. Press and hold the button for 3 seconds or until display shows RESET? then press the button again for 3 seconds to confirm.
