SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

To reset show the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the display by pressing the MENU button. Press the SET/CLEAR button while the display is active the reset the engine oil life system. A single chime will sound after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

To reset, display the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the DIC using the DIC controls on the right side of the steering wheel. Press and hold the CHECK MARK button to clear the CHANGE OIL SOON message and OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

To reset, display the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the DIC using the DIC controls on the right side of the steering wheel. Press and hold the CHECK MARK button to clear the CHANGE OIL SOON message and OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

To reset, display the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the DIC using the DIC controls on the right side of the steering wheel. Press and hold the CHECK MARK button to clear the CHANGE OIL SOON message and OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

Oil Capacity: All Wheel Drive 5.7 liters . Front Wheel Drive 4.7 liters with filter
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset, display the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the DIC using the DIC controls on the right side of the steering wheel. Press and hold the CHECK MARK button to clear the CHANGE OIL SOON message and OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. Access the VEHICLE INFORMATION MENU by pressing the DIC menu button on the turn signal lever. Scroll through the menu items to find REMAINING OIL LIFE using the thumbwheel and press SET/CLR. The oil life will reset to 100%.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. Access the VEHICLE INFORMATION MENU by pressing the DIC menu button on the turn signal lever. Scroll through the menu items to find REMAINING OIL LIFE using the thumbwheel and press SET/CLR. The oil life will reset to 100%.

To reset the oil light, turn the ignition key to the run position without starting. Push the gas pedal three times within a five second span. Then turn the key off. If the light is still present, perform the reset instructions again.

On the DIC menu display the RESET OIL LIFE. While the OIL LIFE display is active press and hold the SEL button for several seconds. The OIL LIFE system will successfully be reset when the display shows 100% OIL LIFE.

To reset OIL LIFE turn key to on position, press and hold OPTION button on the Drivers Information Center until ENGINE OIL MONITOR is displayed. Press the SET/RESET to reset CHANGE OIL SOON display. For vehicles equipped with an up-level DIC press the gauge button to display 100% OIL LIFE REMAINING. Turn key to off position. Repeat procedure if display is not reset when vehicle is re-started.

For vehicles equipped with an up-level DIC press the gauge button to display 100% OIL LIFE REMAINING. Turn key to off position. Repeat procedure if display is not reset when vehicle is re-started.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: CHANGE ENGINE OIL message can be reset after an oil change by pressing the TRIP button to display the OIL LIFE percentage. Press and hold RESET for 2 seconds until OIL LIFE REMAINING 100% appears. Repeat the procedure if the CHANGE ENGINE OIL light comes back on when the vehicle is restarted.

To reset, turn the ignition ON. On the turn signal switch press the MENU button and select the VEHICLE INFORMATION SYSTEM menu by using the adjustment wheel. Select OIL LIFE SYSTEM using the adjustment wheel and select menu. Press and hold the brake pedal while pressing the SET/CLR button on the turn signal to reset the system.

To reset, turn the ignition ON. On the turn signal switch press the MENU button and select the VEHICLE INFORMATION SYSTEM menu by using the adjustment wheel. Select OIL LIFE SYSTEM using the adjustment wheel and select menu. Press and hold the brake pedal while pressing the SET/CLR button on the turn signal to reset the system.

To reset, display the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the DIC using the DIC controls on the right side of the steering wheel. Press and hold the CHECK MARK button to clear the CHANGE OIL SOON message and OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. (Do not start the engine). On the left side of the steering wheel simultaneously press and hold the RESET and DIC INFO buttons to display the OIL LIFE RESET message. Press and hold RESET again until ACKNOWLEDGED is shown in the DIC display. Ignition may now be turned to the OFF/LOCK position.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. (Do not start the engine). On the left side of the steering wheel simultaneously press and hold the RESET and DIC INFO buttons to display the OIL LIFE RESET message. Press and hold RESET again until ACKNOWLEDGED is shown in the DIC display. Ignition may now be turned to the OFF/LOCK position.

On the left side of the steering wheel simultaneously press and hold the RESET and DIC INFO buttons to display the OIL LIFE RESET message. Press and hold RESET again until ACKNOWLEDGED is shown in the DIC display. Ignition may now be turned to the OFF/LOCK position.
To reset the OIL LIFE to 100% press and hold the SET/CLR button on the DIC for at least 5 seconds.
Press the SET/CLR button to reset the engine oil life system while the OIL LIFE display is shown. A single chime will be heard after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE is reset to 100%.
Press the SET/CLR button to reset the engine oil life system while the OIL LIFE display is shown. A single chime will be heard after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE is reset to 100%.
To reset the OIL LIFE to 100% press and hold the SET/CLR button on the DIC for at least 5 seconds.

To reset, select OIL LIFE using the SELECT knob on the DIC menu. To start the OIL LIFE reset procedure press SELECT and ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO RESET will appear on the DIC menu. Choose YES using the SELECT button and RESET OIL LIFE and then 100% OIL LIFE will be displayed in the DEC menu.
To reset display OIL LIFE REMAINING by pressing the DIC vehicle information button. Reset the OIL LIFE to 100% by pressing and holding the DIC SET/RESET button for 5 seconds.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position (without starting the engine) and press the menu button on the DIC until the display shows REMAINING OIL LIFE. Locate the SET/CLEAR button and press and hold until display shows 100% then turn ignition to LOCK/OFF position.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position (without starting the engine) and press the menu button on the DIC until the display shows REMAINING OIL LIFE. Locate the SET/CLEAR button and press and hold until display shows 100% then turn ignition to LOCK/OFF position.

Without starting the engine, turn the ignition key to the ON position. For vehicles with push button start: Without attempting to start the engine and without pressing the brake pedal, press and hold the START/STOP button for 2 seconds. Simultaneously press and hold both the brake and accelerator pedals until the display shows SERVICE: OIL RESET IN PROG then after about 25 seconds SERVICE: OIL RESET COMPLETE. Release both pedals and the OIL RESET message will go away. Turn the key to OFF. On push button start vehicles press the START/STOP button to completely turn off vehicle.

To confirm press OK and the system will display SETTING and then SETTING COMPLETE when the reset is finished.

Transfer Case: T.O.D without 4L Mercon LV or Electronic Shift on Fly with 4L use XL-12 or equivalent
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset OIL LIFE press and hold SELECT/RESET button on the instrument panel until display shows HOLD RESET FOR SETUP MENU. Press and hold again until display shows HOLD RESET FOR SYSTEM CHECK, press and release the RESET button until the display shows OIL LIFE % HOLD RESET = NEW. Press and hold RESET again until OIL LIFE SET TO 100% is displayed. Push reset button again to exit the system.

To reset, navigate through the message center using the left steering wheel controls. Move through the message center choices using the UP/DOWN buttons then use the LEFT/RIGHT arrow buttons to select OIL LIFE RESET and select set to 100%. To confirm press OK and the system will display SETTING and then SETTING COMPLETE when the reset is finished.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition switch to the ON position. On push button start engines, without pressing the brake pedal and without starting the vehicle, press and hold the start button for 2 seconds. Fully press and hold both brake and accelerator pedals. After about 2 seconds a message is displayed saying that reset is in progress and about 25 seconds later the display will show that reset is complete. Brake and accelerator pedals can now be released.

After about 2 seconds a message is displayed saying that reset is in progress and about 25 seconds later the display will show that reset is complete. Brake and accelerator pedals can now be released.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

For approximately 10 seconds press and hold the SELECT/RESET button until the codes for the engine oil life and the the maintenance items blink. Release and then press and hold again (about 5 seconds) until the codes disappear and the ENGINE OIL LIFE shows 100.

With the ignition switch in the ON position, go to the MAINTENANCE INFO screen and press the SOURCE button and the intelligent multi-information display will show the OIL LIFE RESET mode. Using the - button select YES and then press SOURCE. The ENGINE OIL LIFE will return to 100% and the maintenance items will disappear.

With the ignition switch set to ON press the INFO button to cancel the display if system messages are shown. Press and hold the SELECT/RESET button until the display shows the ENGINE OIL LIFE RESET mode (about 10 seconds). Repeatedly press the INFO button to display the RESET indicator then press and hold the SEL/RESET button until the maintenance item code(s) disappear and display shows that the ENGINE OIL LIFE has reset to 100.

Repeatedly press and release SEL/RESET button until display shows engine oil life indicator. Continue to hold button until OIL LIFE RESET is displayed (approximately 10 seconds) the press the INFO button , select RESET, then press the SEL/RESET button again to display OIL LIFE 100%.

To reset, if equipped with a maintenance system, press the DISP button with the engine running (not moving) or with the ignition switch in the ON position, for more than 2 seconds. The MAINTENANCE group will be shown in the LCD display on the cluster. Press the UP or DOWN arrow buttons and select an item by pressing the DISP button then selecting the desired maintenance schedule. Press the DISP button for more than 2 seconds to exit the MAINTENANCE group.

Using button A cycle to the MAINTENANCE menu then cycle to ENGINE OIL to reset the distance to change. Repeat to reset OIL FILTER. Menu will show SETTING-MAINTENANCE-OIL FILTER.

To reset turn ignition to OFF and press and hold the REAR FOG LAMP switch until POWER MODE 6 is reached on the vehicle. Without placing your foot on the brake press the START button and release the REAR FOG LAMP switch quickly. Simultaneously press and hold the TRIP COMPUTER CYCLE switch and the REAR FOG LAMP switch. Hold until RESETTING SERVICE MODE and then after 10 seconds SERVICE MODE RESET is shown in the message center display. Release switches and turn OFF ignition.

To reset turn the ignition to the ON position and access the instrument cluster MAIN MEN by pressing OK on the right side of the steering wheel controls. Select the SERVICE MENU by pressing the directional buttons and select the last menu option. Press and hold both the TRIP and DOWN directional buttons for 10 seconds to reset the service indicator message the turn the ignition to the OFF position. Repeat the process if the message has not been cleared when the ignition is turned back to ON.

To reset turn the ignition to the ON position and open the hood and driver side door. The instrument cluster will display a service resetting message. Fully depress and hold both the brake and accelerator pedals for 10 seconds then turn the ignition to OFF. Repeat the procedure if the message has not cleared when the ignition is turned back to the ON position.

With the hybrid system operating switch the display to the TRIP METER A then turn OFF the POWER switch. To reset OIL, start vehicle and set the display to TRIP METER A. Turn engine OFF. Press and hold the reset button on the trip meter while turning the ENGINE START STOP switch to ON without starting the engine. Continue to hold button until 000000 is shown on the display.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: With the engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn OFF the engine. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET while turning the ignition to IGNITION ON without starting engine and continue to hold until COMPLETE is shown in the TRIP METER. Reset mode will be cancelled if the engine is started.

While the hybrid system is operating switch the display to to trip meter A. Turn OFF power switch. Press TRIP meter reset and hold while turning POWER switch ON (do not start). Continue to hold TRIP button until the display shows that the system has reset.

OIL REPLACEMENT REMINDER light can be reset by turning OFF ignition switch with with odometer reading showing and turning the ignition ON while pressing the ODO/TRIP button. Hold button until odometer reads 000000 (about 5 seconds) and the light turns off. If the light continues to flash the system has not reset and the procedure should be repeated.

To reset select TRIP METER A and then turn OFF the POWER SWITCH. Press and hold the ODO/TRIP button while turning ON the POWER SWITCH. Continue to hold for 5 seconds until 000000 flashes in the TRIP METER and the message in the display disappears.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset OIL LIFE press and hold SELECT/RESET button on the instrument panel until display shows HOLD RESET FOR SETUP MENU. Press and hold again until display shows HOLD RESET FOR SYSTEM CHECK, press and release the RESET button until the display shows OIL LIFE % HOLD RESET = NEW. Press and hold RESET again until OIL LIFE SET TO 100% is displayed. Push reset button again to exit the system.

Transfer Case: T.O.D without 4L Mercon LV Electronic Shift on the Fly with 4L XL-12

Press and hold again until display shows HOLD RESET FOR SYSTEM CHECK, press and release the RESET button until the display shows OIL LIFE % HOLD RESET = NEW. Press and hold RESET again until OIL LIFE SET TO 100% is displayed. Push reset button again to exit the system.

To reset, switch the ignition ON to reset the MAINTENANCE monitor on the TYPE A INST. CLUSTER. On the INFO switch use the UP/DOWN to select MAINTENANCE. Next select SCHEDULED using UP/DOWN on the INFO switch, then select SET TIME or SET DISTANCE using UP/DOWN. Press INFO to return remaining time and distance values to previously set values. Press INFO if no changes are necessary.

Engine Oil: 5W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula or 0W-40 Synthetic European Car Formula
Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset make sure doors, trunk, and engine hood are closed then turn ignition to the 1 position with key inserted in the ignition. The multifunction display will show the MILEAGE counter. If it is not displayed repeatedly press the scroll forward button on the left, down arrow until mileage counter is displayed. Display the TRIP menu item in the multifunction display by repeatedly pressing the system selection button, or LEFT arrow. TRIP will stay selected for 5 seconds then press and hold the ACCEPT PHONE CALL button and within 1 second pressing the OK button. Hold both buttons for 5 seconds and VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMETER TEST, AND ASSYST PLUS will show in the multifunction display on the workshop menu. Using the scroll forward button repeatedly press until ASSYST PLUS is highlighted and press the OK button to confirm. The multifunction display will show SERVICE DATA AND FULL SERVICE. Scroll to highlight FULL SERVICE and press OK to confirm. The multifunction display will now show the current service items. Scroll to CONFIRM SERVICE and press OK to confirm. OIL QUAL AND SERV. CARRIED OUT? will show in the display. Select and confirm engine oil specification on vehicles with engine 272,273 then scroll forward to highlight YES and press OK to confirm. Display will show NO TAKE BACK POSSIBLE. To reset, make sure that doors, hood, and trunk lids are closed then turn the key to the 1 position. The multifunction display should show the standard display. If it does not, repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to select the standard display. Repeatedly press the system selection button until TRIP is highlighted in the display and remains for 5 seconds. Immediately within that 5 seconds press and hold the ACCEPT AND END PHONE CALL button and within 1 second press and hold OK.The workshop menu with the tabs VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMNETER TEST, CHANGE BRAKE PADS, AND ASSYST PLUS will show in the multifuntion display. Repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select and highlight the ASSYST PLUS tab then press OK to confirm. The multifunction display will show SERVICE DATA AND FULL SERVICE. Select and highlight FULL SERVICE by pressing the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. CONFIRM SERV and other current service items will be shown in the display. Select and highlight CONFIRM SERV using the FORWARD and BACKWARD scroll button and press OK to confirm. The display will show the ENGINE OIL SELECTION. Use the FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select the oil specification and press OK to confirm. Oil selected and SERV CONDUCTED? will be shown in the multifunction display. Select and highlight YES using the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. TAKE BACK NOT POSSIBLE, CONFIRM, and CANCEL TABS WILL SHOW IN THE MULTIFUNCTION DISPLAY. Select and highlight the configuration using the scroll buttons and press OK to confirm. When display will shows FULL SERVICE CARRIED OUT press OK. Press BACK and VCS OFF button repeatedly until the standard display is shown and turn the key to 0.

To reset make sure that doors, hood, and trunk lid are closed. Turn the key to the 1 position and make sure that the multi-function display shows the standard display. If it does not repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACK button to reach the standard display. Repeatedly press the SYSTEM SELECTION button the display highlights the TRIP menu item for 5 seconds. Within that 5 seconds press and hold the ACCEPT and END PHONE CALL button and within 1 second press and hold the OK button. VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMETER TEST, AND ASSYST PLUS tabs will be shown in the morkshop menu of the multi-function display. Repeatedly the scroll FORWARD and BACK buttons to highlight ASSYST PLUS and press OK to confirm. The multi-function display will show SERVICE DATA and FULL SERVICE. Scroll to highlight FULL SERVICE on press OK to confirm. The current service items will show in the display. Repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD button to display CONFIRM SERVICE and press OK to confirm. The display will show SERVICE CARRIED OUT? or the oil selection. Select the specification of engine oil used by scrolling FORWARD and BACKWARD then press OK to confirm. the engine oil used must be confirmed by the appropriate Operating Fluid sheets to maximize the mileage interval of the vehicle.

If it is not displayed repeatedly press the scroll forward button on the left, down arrow until mileage counter is displayed. Display the TRIP menu item in the multifunction display by repeatedly pressing the system selection button, or LEFT arrow. TRIP will stay selected for 5 seconds then press and hold the ACCEPT PHONE CALL button and within 1 second pressing the OK button. Hold both buttons for 5 seconds and VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMETER TEST, AND ASSYST PLUS will show in the multifunction display on the workshop menu. Using the scroll forward button repeatedly press until ASSYST PLUS is highlighted and press the OK button to confirm. The multifunction display will show SERVICE DATA AND FULL SERVICE. Scroll to highlight FULL SERVICE and press OK to confirm. The multifunction display will now show the current service items. Scroll to CONFIRM SERVICE and press OK to confirm. OIL QUAL AND SERV. CARRIED OUT? will show in the display. Select and confirm engine oil specification on vehicles with engine 272,273 then scroll forward to highlight YES and press OK to confirm. Display will show NO TAKE BACK POSSIBLE. To reset make sure that doors, engine hood, and rear end door or liftgate are closed then turn the ignition switch ON. Repeatedly press the SYSTEM SELECTION button to display the TRIP and TOTAL DISTANCE on the upper multifunction display. Display the SERVICE indicator by pressing the lower scroll FORWARD/BACK button then press and hold the DIMMER switch for about 3 seconds or until the multifunction display shows RESET SERVICE INTERVAL PRESS RESET FOR 3 SECONDS. Press and hold DIMMER switch for 3 seconds or until the upper multifunction display shows SERVICE INTERVAL WAS RESET then turn the ignition to the OFF position.

To reset make sure that doors, engine hood, and rear end door or liftgate are closed then turn the ignition switch ON. Repeatedly press the SYSTEM SELECTION button to display the TRIP and TOTAL DISTANCE on the upper multifunction display. Display the SERVICE indicator by pressing the lower scroll FORWARD/BACK button then press and hold the DIMMER switch for about 3 seconds or until the multifunction display shows RESET SERVICE INTERVAL PRESS RESET FOR 3 SECONDS. Press and hold DIMMER switch for 3 seconds or until the upper multifunction display shows SERVICE INTERVAL WAS RESET then turn the ignition to the OFF position.

To reset, make sure that doors, hood, and trunk lids are closed then turn the key to the 1 position. The multifunction display should show the standard display. If it does not, repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to select the standard display. Repeatedly press the system selection button until TRIP is highlighted in the display and remains for 5 seconds. Immediately within that 5 seconds press and hold the ACCEPT AND END PHONE CALL button and within 1 second press and hold OK.The workshop menu with the tabs VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMNETER TEST, CHANGE BRAKE PADS, AND ASSYST PLUS will show in the multifuntion display. Repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select and highlight the ASSYST PLUS tab then press OK to confirm. The multifunction display will show SERVICE DATA AND FULL SERVICE. Select and highlight FULL SERVICE by pressing the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. CONFIRM SERV and other current service items will be shown in the display. Select and highlight CONFIRM SERV using the FORWARD and BACKWARD scroll button and press OK to confirm. The display will show the ENGINE OIL SELECTION. Use the FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select the oil specification and press OK to confirm. Oil selected and SERV CONDUCTED? will be shown in the multifunction display. Select and highlight YES using the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. TAKE BACK NOT POSSIBLE, CONFIRM, and CANCEL TABS WILL SHOW IN THE MULTIFUNCTION DISPLAY. Select and highlight the configuration using the scroll buttons and press OK to confirm. When display will shows FULL SERVICE CARRIED OUT press OK. Press BACK and VCS OFF button repeatedly until the standard display is shown and turn the key to 0.

If it does not repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD/BACK button on the left down arrow to display the mileage counter. Highlight the TRIP menu item by pressing the system selection button or left arrow button. The TRIP menu will stay highlighted for 5 seconds. Press and hold the ACCEPT PHONE CALL button and press and hold the the OK button within 1 second. Continue to hold both buttons for 5 seconds. VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMETER TEST, AND ASSYST PLUS will be displayed on the WORKSHOP menu in the multifuntion display. Select the ASSYST PLUS menu by pressing and scrolling the FORWARD/BACK BUTTON. . To confirm press the n button.The multifunction display will now show SERVICE DATA and FULL SERVICE. Highlight FULL SERVICE using the scroll FORWARD/BACK button and confirm by pressing OK. The multifunction display will show the current service items. Highlight CONFIRM SERVICE by scrolling the FORWARD/BACK button and press OK to confirm. OIL SELECTION or SERVICE CARRIED OUT will show in the display. Use the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to select the specification the the engine oil and press OK to confirm. Select YES by scrolling forward and press n to confirm.The multifunction display will then show NO TAKE BACK POSSIBLE.

To reset turn the ignition switch to ON. To access the SERVICE SCOPE X in XXX KM menu the total kilometers must be displayed. If the display does not show the total kilometers press the SYSTEM SELECTION button on the steering wheel in the lower control panel until the display shows the total kilometers. Repeatedly press the UPPER CONTROL PANEL on the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to display SERVICE SCOPE X IN XXX KM. On the instrument cluster press and hold the 0 button until you hear a beep and then press the SYSTEM SELECTION button on the LOWER CONTROL PANEL once. To display SERVICE IN XXX KM in the multifunction display press the UPPER CONTROL PANEL of the SCROLL FORWARD/BACK button. on the instrument cluster press the 0 button and the menu CARRY OUT will be displayed. To display the selection menu OIL TYPES press the UPPER CONTROL panel of the SCROLL FORWARD/BACK button. On the UPPER repeatedly press the + and - button to select the desired oil type and then use the SCROLL FORWARD/BACK button in the UPPER CONTROL PANEL to select MARK OIL TYPE. On the instrument cluster press the 0 button for 3 seconds to display SERVICE CONFIRMED then press 0 again to display CARRY OUT and use the + and - on the UPPER CONTROL PANEL to mark the FULL SERVICE BACK menu.

With the ignition switch in the ON position, press and hold the TRIP DISTANCE RECORDER RESET button until the LCD display shows the 1st scope of maintenance work or for about 10 seconds. On the speedometer the UPPER DISPLAY is illuminated by a service symbol. An oil change is denoted by and OIL CAN. The time or distance remaining until next service is shown in the lower speedometer display. Use the rocker switch on the turn signal high beam switch to set the desired maintenance scope. Press the on-board computer button on the turn signal /high beam switch and hold until until RESET appears and then press and hold again to confirm.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON position. On the left side of the display press the square button to display the SETTINGS mode. To display MAINTENANCE, press the circular button until MAINTENANCE is highlighted then press the circular button to set desired interval and press the square button to open the RESET mode. Enter desired distance and select RESET. Enter desired time or distance then repeat the steps to reset ENGINE OIL FILTER.

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

To reset press the square button on the steering wheel and select SETTINGS by pressing the UP and DOWN arrow buttons and press ENTER to select. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to select MAINTENANCE, press ENTER ane then reset the maintenance intervals.

To reset use the NISSAN controller to select the MAINTENANCE key by pressing the INFO button. The display screen will show the maintenance information. Use the NIssan controller to select one of the maintenance reminder keys to change the interval schedule. Select ENGINE OIL, OIL FILTER, TIRE or other reminders and touch + or - keys to choose the desired distance. Press the BACK button to accept the changes. Select the RESET DISTANCE key using the NISSAN controller to reset the reminder schedule distance to 0 mi or km.

On the display select OIL, FILTER on the maintenance screen and use the following items to input the maintenance distance. To change the mileage press the NEXT switch 0 then press and hold to increase every 600 miles of 1,000km. To set no reminders set to "_". Go to the RESET screen and press NEXT screen to reset the accumulated mileage to zero and press the the square enter switch to confirm.

To reset use the NISSAN controller to display the screen to change the maintenance interval and select one of the reminder keys ENGINE OIL, OIL FILTER reminder. Using the NISSAN controller select the interval key to change the maintenance interval. Press the BACK button to accept the changes. Using the NISSAN controller select the RESET DISTANCE key to reset the reminder schedule distance to 0 mi.

To reset turn the ignition to OFF and press and hold the O.D./SET button while turning the ignition to ON then release the button. the instrument cluster display will show a confirmation request. To manually reset the SERVICE INTERVAL check that the vehicle is coded for fixed intervals. Select the SETTINGS menu using the rocker switch or multi function switch and select RESET in the SERVICE menu, press OK and then press OK again to confirm. If using the instrument cluster turn the ignition OFF, then press and hold the SET button while turning ON the ignition. Release SET and then press again briefly to set the clock. The display will be in reset mode and will switch back to the normal display when reset is complete.

To reset, turn OFF the ignition and press and hold the O.D./SET button while turning the ignition ON. Within 20 seconds release the O.D. button and press the button to the left of the O.D./SET button to place the service interval in RESET mode. The display will return to the normal display.

To reset turn the ignition to OFF and press and hold the O.D./SET button while turning the ignition to ON then release the button. the instrument cluster display will show a confirmation request. Press OK on the steering wheel or the button on the bottom of the windshield wiper lever to confirm. The system is now being reset and the normal display will be displayed after a brief period.

To reset select the ON mode by pressing the engine START/STOP button. Press the INFO button to cancel the display if system messages are displayed. Use the INFO button to select CUSTOMIZE SETTING and the press SEL/RESET. Use the INFO button to select MAINTENANCE INFO then press SEL/RESET. The multi-information display will now show the OIL LIFE RESET mode. Select RESET by pressing the INFO button and then press SEL/RESET. The maintenance codes will disappear on the display and OIL LIFE will be reset to 100%.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON position then press and release the SEL/RESET button until the display show the oil life indicator. Oil LIfe will reset to 100%.

To reset turn the ignition to the ON position then press and hold (about 10 seconds) the ODOMETER RESET button until the display shows an OIL CAN icon. On the turn signal lever repeatedly press the ON BOARD COMPUTER button until the display shows RESET. Press and hold again until display shows a CLOCK icon. When the OIL SERVICE reset is complete the display will sow a CHECK MARK icon. Follow same procedures to reset additional services.

To reset service displays turn the ignition to the ON position. NOTE: (ALWAYS reset OIL SERVICE before resetting any other service job). Press and hold RESET on the ODOMETER until the display shows OIL SERVICE. RESET EXECUTABLE will be displayed if a reset is possible. Press ODOMETER RESET button (about 3 seconds) until display shows EXECUTE RESET. Press RESET again for about 3 seconds to confirm. During reset display will show RESET RUNNING and then RESET COMPLETE when system is reset. REpeat above procedure to to reset other services needed.

Oil Capacity: All Wheel Drive . 5.5 liters Rear Wheel Drive . 5.0 liters with filter
Oil Life Reset Instructions: With the ignition switch in the ON position, press and hold the TRIP DISTANCE RECORDER RESET button until the LCD display shows the 1st scope of maintenance work or for about 10 seconds. On the speedometer the UPPER DISPLAY is illuminated by a service symbol. An oil change is denoted by and OIL CAN. The time or distance remaining until next service is shown in the lower speedometer display. Use the rocker switch on the turn signal high beam switch to set the desired maintenance scope. Press the on-board computer button on the turn signal /high beam switch and hold until until RESET appears and then press and hold again to confirm.

With the ignition switch in the ON position, press and hold the TRIP DISTANCE RECORDER RESET button until the LCD display shows the 1st scope of maintenance work or for about 10 seconds. On the speedometer the UPPER DISPLAY is illuminated by a service symbol. An oil change is denoted by and OIL CAN. The time or distance remaining until next service is shown in the lower speedometer display. Use the rocker switch on the turn signal high beam switch to set the desired maintenance scope. Press the on-board computer button on the turn signal /high beam switch and hold until until RESET appears and then press and hold again to confirm.

To reset turn ignition to ON. Display service jobs by pressing the TRIP ODOMETER button for 10 seconds. Select the desired job by pressing the button again from the menu. It will be the oil can icon in the upper display. Time or distance remaining until next service will be shown in the lower display. Press and hold the button for 3 seconds or until display shows RESET? then press the button again for 3 seconds to confirm.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

To reset show the REMAINING OIL LIFE on the display by pressing the MENU button. Press the SET/CLEAR button while the display is active the reset the engine oil life system. A single chime will sound after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE will reset to 100%.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. Access the VEHICLE INFORMATION MENU by pressing the DIC menu button on the turn signal lever. Scroll through the menu items to find REMAINING OIL LIFE using the thumbwheel and press SET/CLR. The oil life will reset to 100%.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. Access the VEHICLE INFORMATION MENU by pressing the DIC menu button on the turn signal lever. Scroll through the menu items to find REMAINING OIL LIFE using the thumbwheel and press SET/CLR. The oil life will reset to 100%.
On the DRIVER INFORMATION CENTER, display the OIL LIFE RESET item and press and hold ENTER (for at least a second) until the display shows ACKNOWLEDGED to show the system has been reset.

To reset the oil light, turn the ignition key to the run position without starting. Push the gas pedal three times within a five second span. Then turn the key off. If the light is still present, perform the reset instructions again.

To reset the oil light, turn the ignition key to the run position without starting. Push the gas pedal three times within a five second span. Then turn the key off. If the light is still present, perform the reset instructions again.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset the oil light, turn the ignition key to the run position without starting. Push the gas pedal three times within a five second span. Then turn the key off. If the light is still present, perform the reset instructions again.

To reset OIL LIFE turn key to on position, press and hold OPTION button on the Drivers Information Center until ENGINE OIL MONITOR is displayed. Press the SET/RESET to reset CHANGE OIL SOON display. For vehicles equipped with an up-level DIC press the gauge button to display 100% OIL LIFE REMAINING. Turn key to off position. Repeat procedure if display is not reset when vehicle is re-started.

Oil Capacity: Eighth Letter of Vin(W) 5.7 liters or Eighth Letter of Vin(T) . 9.9 liters with filter
Oil Life Reset Instructions: CHANGE ENGINE OIL message can be reset after an oil change by pressing the TRIP button to display the OIL LIFE percentage. Press and hold RESET for 2 seconds until OIL LIFE REMAINING 100% appears. Repeat the procedure if the CHANGE ENGINE OIL light comes back on when the vehicle is restarted.

CHANGE ENGINE OIL message can be reset after an oil change by pressing the TRIP button to display the OIL LIFE percentage. Press and hold RESET for 2 seconds until OIL LIFE REMAINING 100% appears. Repeat the procedure if the CHANGE ENGINE OIL light comes back on when the vehicle is restarted.

To reset, turn the ignition ON. On the turn signal switch press the MENU button and select the VEHICLE INFORMATION SYSTEM menu by using the adjustment wheel. Select OIL LIFE SYSTEM using the adjustment wheel and select menu. Press and hold the brake pedal while pressing the SET/CLR button on the turn signal to reset the system.

To reset, turn the ignition ON. On the turn signal switch press the MENU button and select the VEHICLE INFORMATION SYSTEM menu by using the adjustment wheel. Select OIL LIFE SYSTEM using the adjustment wheel and select menu. Press and hold the brake pedal while pressing the SET/CLR button on the turn signal to reset the system.

To reset ENGINE OIL LIFE press the OIL LIFE REMAINING button on the Driver Information Center then press and hold SET/RESET until oil life displays 100%. Repeat procedure if CHANGE OIL SOON is displayed when vehicle is started.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. (Do not start the engine). On the left side of the steering wheel simultaneously press and hold the RESET and DIC INFO buttons to display the OIL LIFE RESET message. Press and hold RESET again until ACKNOWLEDGED is shown in the DIC display. Ignition may now be turned to the OFF/LOCK position.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. (Do not start the engine). On the left side of the steering wheel simultaneously press and hold the RESET and DIC INFO buttons to display the OIL LIFE RESET message. Press and hold RESET again until ACKNOWLEDGED is shown in the DIC display. Ignition may now be turned to the OFF/LOCK position.

Press and hold RESET again until ACKNOWLEDGED is shown in the DIC display. Ignition may now be turned to the OFF/LOCK position.
Press the SET/CLR button to reset the engine oil life system while the OIL LIFE display is shown. A single chime will be heard after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE is reset to 100%.
Press the SET/CLR button to reset the engine oil life system while the OIL LIFE display is shown. A single chime will be heard after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE is reset to 100%.
To reset the OIL LIFE to 100% press and hold the SET/CLR button on the DIC for at least 5 seconds.

To reset, select OIL LIFE using the SELECT knob on the DIC menu. To start the OIL LIFE reset procedure press SELECT and ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO RESET will appear on the DIC menu. Choose YES using the SELECT button and RESET OIL LIFE and then 100% OIL LIFE will be displayed in the DEC menu.

To reset the oil light, turn the ignition key to the run position without starting. Push the gas pedal three times within a five second span. Then turn the key off. If the light is still present, perform the reset instructions again.
To reset display OIL LIFE REMAINING by pressing the DIC vehicle information button. Reset the OIL LIFE to 100% by pressing and holding the DIC SET/RESET button for 5 seconds.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position (without starting the engine) and press the menu button on the DIC until the display shows REMAINING OIL LIFE. Locate the SET/CLEAR button and press and hold until display shows 100% then turn ignition to LOCK/OFF position.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position (without starting the engine) and press the menu button on the DIC until the display shows REMAINING OIL LIFE. Locate the SET/CLEAR button and press and hold until display shows 100% then turn ignition to LOCK/OFF position.

Without starting the engine, turn the ignition key to the ON position. For vehicles with push button start: Without attempting to start the engine and without pressing the brake pedal, press and hold the START/STOP button for 2 seconds. Simultaneously press and hold both the brake and accelerator pedals until the display shows SERVICE: OIL RESET IN PROG then after about 25 seconds SERVICE: OIL RESET COMPLETE. Release both pedals and the OIL RESET message will go away. Turn the key to OFF. On push button start vehicles press the START/STOP button to completely turn off vehicle.

To reset, navigate through the message center using the left steering wheel controls. Move through the message center choices using the UP/DOWN buttons then use the LEFT/RIGHT arrow buttons to select OIL LIFE RESET and select set to 100%. To confirm press OK and the system will display SETTING and then SETTING COMPLETE when the reset is finished.

To reset press and hold both accelerator and brake pedals while turning the ignition switch to RUN. DO NOT use the push button to start.Continue to hold accelerator and brake pedals and quickly press and release the START/STOP button without attempting to start the engine. Continue to hold both pedals for at least 20 seconds then turn the key to OFF on push button start vehicles and completely push START/STOP switch to OFF. To check that reset has been successful start the vehicle to check that the OIL LIFE light is not highlighted.
To reset OIL LIFE press and release SETUP until OIL LIFE=xxx%HOLD RESET=NEW is shown in the display then press and holdRESET for about 2 seconds or until OIL LIFE SET TO 100% is displayed.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset press and release the SETUP button until OIL LIFE XXX% HOLD RESET NEW OIL is displayed in the message center. To reach the desired OIL LIFE START VALUE press and release the RESET button to decrease the value in 10% increments starting from 100%.

To reset, navigate through the message center using the left steering wheel controls. Move through the message center choices using the UP/DOWN buttons then use the LEFT/RIGHT arrow buttons to select OIL LIFE RESET and select set to 100%. To confirm press OK and the system will display SETTING and then SETTING COMPLETE when the reset is finished.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

To reset OIL LIFE turn key to RUN position without starting the vehicle. Slowly press and release the accelerator pedal 3 times within 5 seconds. System is resetting if the OIL LIFE RESET display flashes for five seconds. Turn the ignition key to the lock position.

To reset press the VEHICLE INFORMATION button next to the steering wheel on the instrument panel to display OIL LIFE REMAINING on the DIC. Press and hold the SET/RESET button on the DIC for more than five seconds or until the OIL LIFE changes to 100%, On vehicles without DIC buttons the vehicle must be in PARK in order to access the display. Press and hold the TRIP ODOMETER RESET button for more than 5 seconds or until the OIL LIFE changes to 100%

To reset OIL LIFE turn ON ignition switch and press the METER SELECT/RESET button several times until the display shows the engine oil life indicator. For approximately 10 seconds press and hold the SELECT/RESET button until the codes for the engine oil life and the the maintenance items blink. Release and then press and hold again (about 5 seconds) until the codes disappear and the ENGINE OIL LIFE shows 100.

To reset OIL LIFE turn ON ignition switch and press the METER SELECT/RESET button several times until the display shows the engine oil life indicator. For approximately 10 seconds press and hold the SELECT/RESET button until the codes for the engine oil life and the the maintenance items blink. Release and then press and hold again (about 5 seconds) until the codes disappear and the ENGINE OIL LIFE shows 100.

For approximately 10 seconds press and hold the SELECT/RESET button until the codes for the engine oil life and the the maintenance items blink. To reset press the start/stop button to select ON or turn ignition switch to ON position and press INFO button to cancel message display. Repeatedly press and release SEL/RESET button until display shows engine oil life indicator. Continue to hold button until OIL LIFE RESET is displayed (approximately 10 seconds) the press the INFO button , select RESET, then press the SEL/RESET button again to display OIL LIFE 100%.

With the ignition switch set to ON press the INFO button to cancel the display if system messages are shown. Press and hold the SELECT/RESET button until the display shows the ENGINE OIL LIFE RESET mode (about 10 seconds). Repeatedly press the INFO button to display the RESET indicator then press and hold the SEL/RESET button until the maintenance item code(s) disappear and display shows that the ENGINE OIL LIFE has reset to 100.

With the ignition switch in the ON position repeatedly press the SEL/RESET button to display the ENGINE OIL LIFE indicator. For about 10 seconds press and hold the SEL/RESET button until the MAINTENANCE ITEM codes and the ENGINE OIL LIFE indicator blinks then continue to hold the button for another 5 seconds or until the codes disappear and the display shows that the engine oil life has reset to 100.

To reset, if equipped with a maintenance system, press the DISP button with the engine running (not moving) or with the ignition switch in the ON position, for more than 2 seconds. The MAINTENANCE group will be shown in the LCD display on the cluster. Press the UP or DOWN arrow buttons and select an item by pressing the DISP button then selecting the desired maintenance schedule. Press the DISP button for more than 2 seconds to exit the MAINTENANCE group.

To reset turn ignition to OFF and press and hold the REAR FOG LAMP switch until POWER MODE 6 is reached on the vehicle. Without placing your foot on the brake press the START button and release the REAR FOG LAMP switch quickly. Simultaneously press and hold the TRIP COMPUTER CYCLE switch and the REAR FOG LAMP switch. Hold until RESETTING SERVICE MODE and then after 10 seconds SERVICE MODE RESET is shown in the message center display. Release switches and turn OFF ignition.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition switch or the ENGINE START/STOP to the ON position. Within 10 seconds fully depress the accelerator pedal 3 times then turn the ignition to OFF/STOP. Repeat the procedure if the oil change indicator is displayed when the engine is started.

To reset use the OIL LIFE RESET if the vehicle is equipped with it. ENGINE OIL SERVICE will be displayed if service is required. Press the RESET button for more than 1 second to reset the maintenance schedule.The ENGINE OIL SERVICE MODE will be shown in the display. Press the TRIP button to move items and press the RESET button to select the desired item.

To reset use the OIL LIFE RESET if the vehicle is equipped with it. ENGINE OIL SERVICE will be displayed if service is required. Press the RESET button for more than 1 second to reset the maintenance schedule.The ENGINE OIL SERVICE MODE will be shown in the display. Press the TRIP button to move items and press the RESET button to select the desired item.

To reset turn the ignition to the ON position and access the instrument cluster MAIN MEN by pressing OK on the right side of the steering wheel controls. Select the SERVICE MENU by pressing the directional buttons and select the last menu option. Press and hold both the TRIP and DOWN directional buttons for 10 seconds to reset the service indicator message the turn the ignition to the OFF position. Repeat the process if the message has not been cleared when the ignition is turned back to ON.
To reset SERVICE reminder use SCAN tool.

To reset turn the ignition to the ON position and open the hood and driver side door. The instrument cluster will display a service resetting message. Fully depress and hold both the brake and accelerator pedals for 10 seconds then turn the ignition to OFF. Repeat the procedure if the message has not cleared when the ignition is turned back to the ON position.

To reset turn the ignition to the ON position and open the hood and driver side door. The instrument cluster will display a service resetting message. Fully depress and hold both the brake and accelerator pedals for 10 seconds then turn the ignition to OFF. Repeat the procedure if the message has not cleared when the ignition is turned back to the ON position.
To reset SERVICE reminder use SCAN tool.

With the hybrid system operating switch the display to the TRIP METER A then turn OFF the POWER switch. Turn the POWER switch to the ON position (without starting the motor) while simultaneously pressing and holding the TRIP METER RESET button and continue to hold until 000000 is displayed on the TRIP METER and shows that RESET is complete.

To reset OIL, start vehicle and set the display to TRIP METER A. Turn engine OFF. Press and hold the reset button on the trip meter while turning the ENGINE START STOP switch to ON without starting the engine. Continue to hold button until 000000 is shown on the display.

To reset OIL, start vehicle and set the display to TRIP METER A. Turn engine OFF. Press and hold the reset button on the trip meter while turning the ENGINE START STOP switch to ON without starting the engine. Continue to hold button until 000000 is shown on the display.

To reset OIL, start vehicle and set the display to TRIP METER A. Turn engine OFF. Press and hold the reset button on the trip meter while turning the ENGINE START STOP switch to ON without starting the engine. Continue to hold button until 000000 is shown on the display.

To reset OIL, start vehicle and set the display to TRIP METER A. Turn engine OFF. Press and hold the reset button on the trip meter while turning the ENGINE START STOP switch to ON without starting the engine. Continue to hold button until 000000 is shown on the display.

ENGINE OIL maintenance data can be reset by pressing the DISP button to clear the display. Turn ignition to OFF and then to IG-ON while holding down the trip meter reset button for more than 7 seconds and the display shows OIL MILEAGE RESET. At that time a tone will sound and the master warning light will be lit. System reset will complete after 5 seconds.

To reset switch the display to the odometer with the engine running then turn OFF the engine switch. Without starting the engine set the engine switch to IG-ON mode while simultaneously pressing and holding the

To reset, start engine and switch the display to the ODOMETER then turn the engine off. Press the TRIP METER RESET while turning the engine to IG-ON without starting the engine. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button until display reads 000000.

To reset, start engine and switch the display to the ODOMETER then turn the engine off. Press the TRIP METER RESET while turning the engine to IG-ON without starting the engine. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button until display reads 000000.

Oil Capacity: All Wheel Drive . 9.0 liters Rear Wheel Drive . 8.6 liters with filter
Oil Life Reset Instructions: With the engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn OFF the engine. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET while turning the ignition to IGNITION ON without starting engine and continue to hold until COMPLETE is shown in the TRIP METER. Reset mode will be cancelled if the engine is started.

While the hybrid system is operating switch the display to to trip meter A. Turn OFF power switch. Press TRIP meter reset and hold while turning POWER switch ON (do not start). Continue to hold TRIP button until the display shows that the system has reset.

To reset switch the display to the odometer with the engine running then turn OFF the engine switch. Without starting the engine set the engine switch to IG-ON mode while simultaneously pressing and holding the

OIL REPLACEMENT REMINDER light can be reset by turning OFF ignition switch with with odometer reading showing and turning the ignition ON while pressing the ODO/TRIP button. Hold button until odometer reads 000000 (about 5 seconds) and the light turns off. If the light continues to flash the system has not reset and the procedure should be repeated.

To reset select TRIP METER A and then turn OFF the POWER SWITCH. Press and hold the ODO/TRIP button while turning ON the POWER SWITCH. Continue to hold for 5 seconds until 000000 flashes in the TRIP METER and the message in the display disappears.

On the left hand side oof the information display go to the main menu bar. Select SETTINGS by scrolling up or down and then select OIL LIFE RESET. Press and hold the RESET button until OIL LIFE is restored to 100%.

Transfer Case: T.O.D Transfer without 4L Mercon LV Electronic Shift on the Fly with 4L XL-12
T.O.D without 4L Mercon LV or Electronic Shift on Fly with 4L use XL-12 or equivalent

Oil Capacity: With speed manual transmission . 61.3 liters . Without speed manual transmission . 61.1 liters with filter

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset make sure doors, trunk, and engine hood are closed then turn ignition to the 1 position with key inserted in the ignition. The multifunction display will show the MILEAGE counter. If it is not displayed repeatedly press the scroll forward button on the left, down arrow until mileage counter is displayed. Display the TRIP menu item in the multifunction display by repeatedly pressing the system selection button, or LEFT arrow. TRIP will stay selected for 5 seconds then press and hold the ACCEPT PHONE CALL button and within 1 second pressing the OK button. Hold both buttons for 5 seconds and VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMETER TEST, AND ASSYST PLUS will show in the multifunction display on the workshop menu. Using the scroll forward button repeatedly press until ASSYST PLUS is highlighted and press the OK button to confirm. The multifunction display will show SERVICE DATA AND FULL SERVICE. Scroll to highlight FULL SERVICE and press OK to confirm. The multifunction display will now show the current service items. Scroll to CONFIRM SERVICE and press OK to confirm. OIL QUAL AND SERV. CARRIED OUT? will show in the display. Select and confirm engine oil specification on vehicles with engine 272,273 then scroll forward to highlight YES and press OK to confirm. Display will show NO TAKE BACK POSSIBLE. Select SERVICE DUE by pressing the down arrow ond press OK to confirm. Select FULL SERVICE by pressing down arrow and press OK to confirm.

To reset make sure that doors, hood, and trunk lid are closed. Turn the key to the 1 position and make sure that the multi-function display shows the standard display. If it does not repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACK button to reach the standard display. Repeatedly press the SYSTEM SELECTION button the display highlights the TRIP menu item for 5 seconds. Within that 5 seconds press and hold the ACCEPT and END PHONE CALL button and within 1 second press and hold the OK button. VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMETER TEST, AND ASSYST PLUS tabs will be shown in the morkshop menu of the multi-function display. Repeatedly the scroll FORWARD and BACK buttons to highlight ASSYST PLUS and press OK to confirm. The multi-function display will show SERVICE DATA and FULL SERVICE. Scroll to highlight FULL SERVICE on press OK to confirm. The current service items will show in the display. Repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD button to display CONFIRM SERVICE and press OK to confirm. The display will show SERVICE CARRIED OUT? or the oil selection. Select the specification of engine oil used by scrolling FORWARD and BACKWARD then press OK to confirm. the engine oil used must be confirmed by the appropriate Operating Fluid sheets to maximize the mileage interval of the vehicle.

Within that 5 seconds press and hold the ACCEPT and END PHONE CALL button and within 1 second press and hold the OK button. VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMETER TEST, AND ASSYST PLUS tabs will be shown in the morkshop menu of the multi-function display. To reset, make sure that doors, hood, and trunk lids are closed then turn the key to the 1 position. The multifunction display should show the standard display. If it does not, repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to select the standard display. Repeatedly press the system selection button until TRIP is highlighted in the display and remains for 5 seconds. Immediately within that 5 seconds press and hold the ACCEPT AND END PHONE CALL button and within 1 second press and hold OK.The workshop menu with the tabs VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMNETER TEST, CHANGE BRAKE PADS, AND ASSYST PLUS will show in the multifuntion display. Repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select and highlight the ASSYST PLUS tab then press OK to confirm. The multifunction display will show SERVICE DATA AND FULL SERVICE. Select and highlight FULL SERVICE by pressing the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. CONFIRM SERV and other current service items will be shown in the display. Select and highlight CONFIRM SERV using the FORWARD and BACKWARD scroll button and press OK to confirm. The display will show the ENGINE OIL SELECTION. Use the FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons to select the oil specification and press OK to confirm. Oil selected and SERV CONDUCTED? will be shown in the multifunction display. Select and highlight YES using the scroll FORWARD and BACKWARD buttons and press OK to confirm. TAKE BACK NOT POSSIBLE, CONFIRM, and CANCEL TABS WILL SHOW IN THE MULTIFUNCTION DISPLAY. Select and highlight the configuration using the scroll buttons and press OK to confirm. When display will shows FULL SERVICE CARRIED OUT press OK. Press BACK and VCS OFF button repeatedly until the standard display is shown and turn the key to 0.

To reset make sure that doors, engine hood, and rear end door or liftgate are closed then turn the ignition switch ON. Repeatedly press the SYSTEM SELECTION button to display the TRIP and TOTAL DISTANCE on the upper multifunction display. Display the SERVICE indicator by pressing the lower scroll FORWARD/BACK button then press and hold the DIMMER switch for about 3 seconds or until the multifunction display shows RESET SERVICE INTERVAL PRESS RESET FOR 3 SECONDS. Press and hold DIMMER switch for 3 seconds or until the upper multifunction display shows SERVICE INTERVAL WAS RESET then turn the ignition to the OFF position.

To reset make sure that doors, engine hood and trunk lid or lift gate are closed then place key in the ignition and turn switch to the 1 position. the multifunction display should show the MILEAGE COUNTER. If it does not repeatedly press the scroll FORWARD/BACK button on the left down arrow to display the mileage counter. Highlight the TRIP menu item by pressing the system selection button or left arrow button. The TRIP menu will stay highlighted for 5 seconds. Press and hold the ACCEPT PHONE CALL button and press and hold the the OK button within 1 second. Continue to hold both buttons for 5 seconds. VEHICLE DATA, DYNAMOMETER TEST, AND ASSYST PLUS will be displayed on the WORKSHOP menu in the multifuntion display. Select the ASSYST PLUS menu by pressing and scrolling the FORWARD/BACK BUTTON. . To confirm press the n button.The multifunction display will now show SERVICE DATA and FULL SERVICE. Highlight FULL SERVICE using the scroll FORWARD/BACK button and confirm by pressing OK. The multifunction display will show the current service items. Highlight CONFIRM SERVICE by scrolling the FORWARD/BACK button and press OK to confirm. OIL SELECTION or SERVICE CARRIED OUT will show in the display. Use the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to select the specification the the engine oil and press OK to confirm. Select YES by scrolling forward and press n to confirm.The multifunction display will then show NO TAKE BACK POSSIBLE.

To reset turn the ignition switch to ON. To access the SERVICE SCOPE X in XXX KM menu the total kilometers must be displayed. If the display does not show the total kilometers press the SYSTEM SELECTION button on the steering wheel in the lower control panel until the display shows the total kilometers. Repeatedly press the UPPER CONTROL PANEL on the scroll FORWARD/BACK button to display SERVICE SCOPE X IN XXX KM. On the instrument cluster press and hold the 0 button until you hear a beep and then press the SYSTEM SELECTION button on the LOWER CONTROL PANEL once. To display SERVICE IN XXX KM in the multifunction display press the UPPER CONTROL PANEL of the SCROLL FORWARD/BACK button. on the instrument cluster press the 0 button and the menu CARRY OUT will be displayed. To display the selection menu OIL TYPES press the UPPER CONTROL panel of the SCROLL FORWARD/BACK button. On the UPPER repeatedly press the + and - button to select the desired oil type and then use the SCROLL FORWARD/BACK button in the UPPER CONTROL PANEL to select MARK OIL TYPE. On the instrument cluster press the 0 button for 3 seconds to display SERVICE CONFIRMED then press 0 again to display CARRY OUT and use the + and - on the UPPER CONTROL PANEL to mark the FULL SERVICE BACK menu.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON position. On the left side of the display press the square button to display the SETTINGS mode. To display MAINTENANCE, press the circular button until MAINTENANCE is highlighted then press the circular button to set desired interval and press the square button to open the RESET mode. Enter desired distance and select RESET. Enter desired time or distance then repeat the steps to reset ENGINE OIL FILTER.

On the instrument panel behind the steering wheel press the square button to display the service modes. Push the o button to highlight the maintenance field and press the square button to set desired service interval. the display will then open the reset mode the desired distance for oil and filter mileage intervals can be entered.

Push the o button to highlight the maintenance field and press the square button to set desired service interval. the display will then open the reset mode the desired distance for oil and filter mileage intervals can be entered.

MAINTENANCE NOTICE message can be reset by turning ON the ignition key without starting the engine. Using the joystick and pushing to the right or left, select the MAINTENANCE SCHEDULE key, then select RESET, and press ENTER.

On the display select OIL, FILTER on the maintenance screen and use the following items to input the maintenance distance. To change the mileage press the NEXT switch 0 then press and hold to increase every 600 miles of 1,000km. To set no reminders set to "_". Go to the RESET screen and press NEXT screen to reset the accumulated mileage to zero and press the the square enter switch to confirm.

To reset use the NISSAN controller to display the screen to change the maintenance interval and select one of the reminder keys ENGINE OIL, OIL FILTER reminder. Using the NISSAN controller select the interval key to change the maintenance interval. Press the BACK button to accept the changes. Using the NISSAN controller select the RESET DISTANCE key to reset the reminder schedule distance to 0 mi.

OIL REPLACEMENT REMINDER light can be reset by turning OFF ignition switch with with odometer reading showing and turning the ignition ON while pressing the ODO/TRIP button. Hold button until odometer reads 000000 (about 5 seconds) and the light turns off. If the light continues to flash the system has not reset and the procedure should be repeated.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: To reset. With TRIP METER A reading shown in display turn ignition to OFF position. Simultaneously turn ignition to ON position while pressing and holding the TRIP METER RESET button. Continue to press and hold until display shows 000000 (on systems without multi-information displays) or MAINT REQD RESET MODE COMPLETE (on multi-information display systems).

Continue to press and hold until display shows 000000 (on systems without multi-information displays) or MAINT REQD RESET MODE COMPLETE (on multi-information display systems).

To reset. With TRIP METER A reading shown in display turn ignition to OFF position. Simultaneously turn ignition to ON position while pressing and holding the TRIP METER RESET button. Continue to press and hold until display shows 000000 (on systems without multi-information displays) or MAINT REQD RESET MODE COMPLETE (on multi-information display systems).

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.

With engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A then turn the switch OFF on the ENGINE START STOP. Press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button while turning the IGNITION ON (without starting the engine) on the IGNITION START STOP switch. Do not release the RESET button until the display on the TRIP METER shows 000000.

With the engine running switch the display to TRIP METER A the shut off engine. Simultaneously turn the ENGINE START STOP switch to ENGINE ON (without starting the engine) and press and hold the TRIP METER RESET button until 000000 is show in the display.

To manually reset the SERVICE INTERVAL check that the vehicle is coded for fixed intervals. Select the SETTINGS menu using the rocker switch or multi function switch and select RESET in the SERVICE menu, press OK and then press OK again to confirm. If using the instrument cluster turn the ignition OFF, then press and hold the SET button while turning ON the ignition. Release SET and then press again briefly to set the clock. The display will be in reset mode and will switch back to the normal display when reset is complete.

To reset turn the key to the I position then press the RESET button on the TRIP ODOMETER. Within 2 seconds turn the key to the II position Press and hold the button until the information lamp flashes then release the button.

To reset, turn the ignition to the 1 position then press and hold the TRIP ODOMETER RESET while turning the ignition to the ll position. Wait for about 10 seconds or until the information lamp flashes before releasing. Reset is successful if the instrument beeps.

To reset turn the ignition to the I position. On the TRIP ODOMETER press and hold the RESET button and turn the ignition into the II position. After 10 seconds the the service reminder indicator will start flashing. Release the RESET within 54 seconds of the beginning of the flashing indicator. An audible signal will be heard when the reset has been successful.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON position then press and release the SEL/RESET button until the display show the oil life indicator. For about 10 seconds press and hold the SEL/RESET button until OIL LIFE RESET is displayed then press and release the INFO button until the display shows RESET . Press SEL/RESET button. Oil LIfe will reset to 100%.

With the ignition switch set to ON press the INFO button to cancel the display if system messages are shown. Press and hold the SELECT/RESET button until the display shows the ENGINE OIL LIFE RESET mode (about 10 seconds). Repeatedly press the INFO button to display the RESET indicator then press and hold the SEL/RESET button until the maintenance item code(s) disappear and display shows that the ENGINE OIL LIFE has reset to 100.

To reset press the start/stop button to select ON or turn ignition switch to ON position and press INFO button to cancel message display. Repeatedly press and release SEL/RESET button until display shows engine oil life indicator. Continue to hold button until OIL LIFE RESET is displayed (approximately 10 seconds) the press the INFO button , select RESET, then press the SEL/RESET button again to display OIL LIFE 100%.

To reset press the start/stop button to select ON or turn ignition switch to ON position and press INFO button to cancel message display. Repeatedly press and release SEL/RESET button until display shows engine oil life indicator. Continue to hold button until OIL LIFE RESET is displayed (approximately 10 seconds) the press the INFO button , select RESET, then press the SEL/RESET button again to display OIL LIFE 100%.

To reset turn the ignition to the ON position then press and hold (about 10 seconds) the ODOMETER RESET button until the display shows an OIL CAN icon. On the turn signal lever repeatedly press the ON BOARD COMPUTER button until the display shows RESET. Press and hold again until display shows a CLOCK icon. When the OIL SERVICE reset is complete the display will sow a CHECK MARK icon. Follow same procedures to reset additional services.

On the turn signal lever repeatedly press the ON BOARD COMPUTER button until the display shows RESET. Press and hold again until display shows a CLOCK icon. When the OIL SERVICE reset is complete the display will sow a CHECK MARK icon. Follow same procedures to reset additional services.

To reset service displays turn the ignition to the ON position. NOTE: (ALWAYS reset OIL SERVICE before resetting any other service job). Press and hold RESET on the ODOMETER until the display shows OIL SERVICE. RESET EXECUTABLE will be displayed if a reset is possible. Press ODOMETER RESET button (about 3 seconds) until display shows EXECUTE RESET. Press RESET again for about 3 seconds to confirm. During reset display will show RESET RUNNING and then RESET COMPLETE when system is reset. REpeat above procedure to to reset other services needed.

To reset turn ignition to ON. Display service jobs by pressing the TRIP ODOMETER button for 10 seconds. Select the desired job by pressing the button again from the menu. It will be the oil can icon in the upper display. Time or distance remaining until next service will be shown in the lower display. Press and hold the button for 3 seconds or until display shows RESET? then press the button again for 3 seconds to confirm.

SERVICE REMINDER Indicator is reset by turning ignition switch on (without starting engine) and pressing and holding the MODE button until the display shows OIL LIFE LEFT then holding SET until the display shows 100%. At that time 3 chimes will be heard and the message will go out. Should the CHANGE ENGINE OIL SOON returns when the vehicle is started repeat reset process.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. Access the VEHICLE INFORMATION MENU by pressing the DIC menu button on the turn signal lever. Scroll through the menu items to find REMAINING OIL LIFE using the thumbwheel and press SET/CLR. The oil life will reset to 100%.

Without starting the engine turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. Access the VEHICLE INFORMATION MENU by pressing the DIC menu button on the turn signal lever. Scroll through the menu items to find REMAINING OIL LIFE using the thumbwheel and press SET/CLR. The oil life will reset to 100%.
On the DRIVER INFORMATION CENTER, display the OIL LIFE RESET item and press and hold ENTER (for at least a second) until the display shows ACKNOWLEDGED to show the system has been reset.
On the DRIVER INFORMATION CENTER, display the OIL LIFE RESET item and press and hold ENTER (for at least a second) until the display shows ACKNOWLEDGED to show the system has been reset.

To reset, turn the ignition ON. On the turn signal switch press the MENU button and select the VEHICLE INFORMATION SYSTEM menu by using the adjustment wheel. Select OIL LIFE SYSTEM using the adjustment wheel and select menu. Press and hold the brake pedal while pressing the SET/CLR button on the turn signal to reset the system.

To reset the oil light, turn the ignition key to the run position without starting. Push the gas pedal three times within a five second span. Then turn the key off. If the light is still present, perform the reset instructions again.

To reset OIL LIFE turn key to on position, press and hold OPTION button on the Drivers Information Center until ENGINE OIL MONITOR is displayed. Press the SET/RESET to reset CHANGE OIL SOON display. For vehicles equipped with an up-level DIC press the gauge button to display 100% OIL LIFE REMAINING. Turn key to off position. Repeat procedure if display is not reset when vehicle is re-started.

To reset OIL LIFE turn key to on position, press and hold OPTION button on the Drivers Information Center until ENGINE OIL MONITOR is displayed. Press the SET/RESET to reset CHANGE OIL SOON display. For vehicles equipped with an up-level DIC press the gauge button to display 100% OIL LIFE REMAINING. Turn key to off position. Repeat procedure if display is not reset when vehicle is re-started.

To reset the oil light, turn the ignition key to the run position without starting. Push the gas pedal three times within a five second span. Then turn the key off. If the light is still present, perform the reset instructions again.

Oil Life Reset Instructions: CHANGE ENGINE OIL message can be reset after an oil change by pressing the TRIP button to display the OIL LIFE percentage. Press and hold RESET for 2 seconds until OIL LIFE REMAINING 100% appears. Repeat the procedure if the CHANGE ENGINE OIL light comes back on when the vehicle is restarted.

CHANGE ENGINE OIL message can be reset after an oil change by pressing the TRIP button to display the OIL LIFE percentage. Press and hold RESET for 2 seconds until OIL LIFE REMAINING 100% appears. Repeat the procedure if the CHANGE ENGINE OIL light comes back on when the vehicle is restarted.

To reset, turn the ignition ON. On the turn signal switch press the MENU button and select the VEHICLE INFORMATION SYSTEM menu by using the adjustment wheel. Select OIL LIFE SYSTEM using the adjustment wheel and select menu. Press and hold the brake pedal while pressing the SET/CLR button on the turn signal to reset the system.

To reset, turn the ignition ON. On the turn signal switch press the MENU button and select the VEHICLE INFORMATION SYSTEM menu by using the adjustment wheel. Select OIL LIFE SYSTEM using the adjustment wheel and select menu. Press and hold the brake pedal while pressing the SET/CLR button on the turn signal to reset the system.

To reset ENGINE OIL LIFE press the OIL LIFE REMAINING button on the Driver Information Center then press and hold SET/RESET until oil life displays 100%. Repeat procedure if CHANGE OIL SOON is displayed when vehicle is started.

Without starting the engine, turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. To enter the personalization menu press and hold the RESET and DIC INFO buttons on the left side the of the steering wheel simultaneously. When display shows OIL LIFE RESET, press and hold RESET until ACKNOWLEDGED is shown in the DIC display.

Without starting the engine, turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position. To enter the personalization menu press and hold the RESET and DIC INFO buttons on the left side the of the steering wheel simultaneously. When display shows OIL LIFE RESET, press and hold RESET until ACKNOWLEDGED is shown in the DIC display.
Press the SET/CLR button to reset the engine oil life system while the OIL LIFE display is shown. A single chime will be heard after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE is reset to 100%.
Press the SET/CLR button to reset the engine oil life system while the OIL LIFE display is shown. A single chime will be heard after a few seconds and the OIL LIFE is reset to 100%.

To reset, select OIL LIFE using the SELECT knob on the DIC menu. To start the OIL LIFE reset procedure press SELECT and ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO RESET will appear on the DIC menu. Choose YES using the SELECT button and RESET OIL LIFE and then 100% OIL LIFE will be displayed in the DEC menu.

To reset the oil light, turn the ignition key to the run position without starting. Push the gas pedal three times within a five second span. Then turn the key off. If the light is still present, perform the reset instructions again.
To reset display OIL LIFE REMAINING by pressing the DIC vehicle information button. Reset the OIL LIFE to 100% by pressing and holding the DIC SET/RESET button for 5 seconds.
To reset display OIL LIFE REMAINING by pressing the DIC vehicle information button. Reset the OIL LIFE to 100% by pressing and holding the DIC SET/RESET button for 5 seconds.

ENGINE OIL LIFE SYSTEM can be reset by turning the ignition to ON (without starting the engine), and pressing and releasing the stem button on the instrument panes until display shows the OIL LIFE and the RESET messages alternating. Press and hold the stem button until you hear some beeps then turn key to LOCK position. Repeat the procedure if the CHANGE OIL message comes back on when the vehicle is restarted.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position (without starting the engine) and press the menu button on the DIC until the display shows REMAINING OIL LIFE. Locate the SET/CLEAR button and press and hold until display shows 100% then turn ignition to LOCK/OFF position.

To reset OIL LIFE turn the ignition to the ON/RUN position (without starting the engine) and press the menu button on the DIC until the display shows REMAINING OIL LIFE. Locate the SET/CLEAR button and press and hold until display shows 100% then turn ignition to LOCK/OFF position.

To reset OIL LIFE turn key to RUN position without starting the vehicle. Slowly press and release the accelerator pedal 3 times within 5 seconds. System is resetting if the OIL LIFE RESET display flashes for five seconds. Turn the ignition key to the lock position.

To reset, navigate through the message center using the left steering wheel controls. Move through the message center choices using the UP/DOWN buttons then use the LEFT/RIGHT arrow buttons to select OIL LIFE RESET and select set to 100%. To confirm press OK and the system will display SETTING and then SETTING COMPLETE when the reset is finished.
